Reviews.Title: So far everything is nearly perfect
Reviews.Author: Charles S. Yordy III "Charlie"
Reviews.Content: Just got this last night at a big box store.  So far I have no complaints.  The picture looks even better in my home than it did at the store, where the contrast and vibrancy of colors "popped" far more than comparable models around it.  This TV replaces a Samsung LN32A450 32-Inch, bought end of 2008, and is our main living room TV.Pros:  Seems like the the best 1080p LED Smart TV at its size for the money; love the picture; the speakers are completely satisfactory for our purposes (seem a good bit stronger than the old TV); the Smart features are very cool and so far work great, but we've only started messing with them; 3 HDMI ports make it easy to connect cable, game system, and any other device we may acquire in the future.Cons:  using the remote for web browsing or apps isn't the best, but we may just get a wireless keyboard and mouse to go with this - already tested a Logitech wireless USB mouse with it and it works perfectly; watched 3 consecutive Youtube videos without incident, but it had trouble loading a 4th...I've read that the wireless card can struggle, so we'll see how that is over the long term; accessing Game Mode requires three steps through the menus, but it doesn't take too long using a wireless mouse, and I think it switched off Game Mode automatically when we deactivated the console and went back to cable.Overall:  After 1 day it easily gets an A+. Reviews.Title: Excellent picture AND sound, software needs some improvement
Reviews.Author: Goldengate "Goldengate"
Reviews.Content: NOTE: Scroll to bottom of review to read 2014 updates -- I am returning this TV.This TV was released in February as Samsung's "budget" 32-inch  As of this writing it's going for around $475, so about $200 more than the budget Smart TV's from Vizio.  First my review of the TV, then I'll compare it to Vizio's product VIZIO E320i-A0 32-inch 720p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV, which I have also purchased and decided to return in favor of this unit.  As you would expect, the TV has a great picture. Smooth, no pixelation, even sports look great on here.  It's advertised as a 60hz -- but then the box refers to "120 Tru Motion" so I'm not sure what to make of that, but suffice it to say that refresh rates are good.  The remote control is decent - lights up at night and has good sized buttons, but I'd like dedicated buttons for Netflix and Amazon VOD.  This TV begins to blur the line between TV and computer... the internet browser is competent, but pretty frustrating to use without a keyboard.  You can hook up a USB keyboard through the TV's slot.  This TV does NOT accommodate bluetooth keyboards, so wireless is out of the picture.  I believe the next model up of Samsung (the 6000 series) accommodates Bluetooth as that is referenced in the manual.  The "Smart Apps" section reveals many apps (Pandora, Picasa, etc) that you would find on your Smartphone.  Due to the dual core of the TV's processor, apps load quickly and the TV starts immediately.  As for the sound, it's really decent to good.  You're not ever going to get good base etc without an external sound source on any HDTV... but this provides a good viewing experience.  Figuring out the DLNA networking (to watch videos and pictures stored on my computer) was unnecessarily complex (very simple on the Vizio).  The TV couldn't "see" other devices on the home network until I clicked "Play to" on the computer in the right click context menu and selected the Samsung.  The Samsung asked for permission to link to the computer and then I was able to browse.  I'm sure this will be fixed in a future software update.  By the way, Netflix, Amazon, every app I have tried works great.I think the software on these "smart TV's" is still overly complex to navigate... At some point a company like Apple is going to figure this out and make a truly seamless intuitive experience.  For example, to get to my media on my computer, I have to click "smart apps" then scroll to video, click that, then select a source, then start scrolling through files on the computer.  There has to be a better way.  Having said that, it's not terrible, and the dual core makes for gorgeous animated menus and really nice response time.Comparing it to the Vizio... if you are thinking "Should I spend the $200 more for the Samsung?" here's why I ended up returning the Vizio in comparison to this unit.  First off the positives: The Vizio had a gorgeous picture also, comparable to the Samsung.  So it's a draw between the devices.  But in every other aspect, Samsung wins.  Setup on the Samsung was a breeze -- it scanned all of my Comcast digital channels WITHOUT a converter box, and then automatically subtracted out the scrambled channels.  Vizio couldn't/didn't do this.  Samsung also has an interactive/nice guide much like the guide you'd see on digital TV/satellite... grid format that tells you what's on all the channels.  Vizio didn't have that.  The Vizio TV took 5-9 seconds to start.  That's a long time when you're trying to catch the end of a show.  Samsung starts up instantaneously.  The Vizio had TERRIBLE sound -- everyone sounded like they had a lisp when watching TV... the Samsung has a million sound options including even an equalizer.  Great sound.  There are many more apps on Samsung's unit, and there's also the Samsung version of video on demand where you can download and watch movies.  Vizio has placed a button for this on their remote control but it is still a "coming attraction."If all you care about is a nice picture, get the Vizio.  But if you care about sound and the internet apps, as well as platform stability, get the Samsung.  They are both energy efficient - the Samsung is $6/year according to the Energy Wise label on the set and the Vizio is $8.This TV actually begins to blue the line between TV, computer and tablet.  You can attach a keyboard.  You can also attach a webcam and have Skype video calls.  There's also a social app integration that I don't plan to use where you can link everything to Facebook and other social sites, sharing comments on TV shows etc with your friends.  Not my style but some might like that.  As I use more of the functions on this TV I will update this review, but for now, hope this helps!UPDATE January 2014:  So less than a year later and I'm having some pretty significant trouble with this TV.  I've spent four hours on multiple phone calls with Samsung to resolve, but they have been unable to.  In short, they released a firmware update last week which made the Netflix app not work... and nothing (factory reset, having them take over the TV from remote somewhere in Japan) will get this working yet.  A fix is always "24 hours away" but the deadline comes and goes with no fix.  AT this point the new 2014 models should be coming out and perhaps their software will be more stable but this TV has really been a disappointment.  One other issue -when you are viewing videos / movies via DLNA streaming you cannot fast forward or rewind, and there is no resume function if you watch half the movie and turn the TV off (or have a power failure) you have to start watching the movie over!  I'm not sure it's fair to change my star review on this TV at this time -- I will think about it and see if Samsung is finally able to get this TV working, but I have to say this whole experience has soured me on the Samsung brand.UPDATE February 2014:  After trying and trying with Samsung, it appears they are unable to fix their firmware update.  The TV displays a "no new firmware" when you check for updates and Netflix is still broken.  Basically, Samsung has great hardware but terrible software, and in the era of Smart TV's you have to have both.  Fortunately Amazon stood behind Samsung and is taking this piece of junk back, but I have to go through the hassle of taking it off the wall, boxing it, and then installing a new one (I'm ordering the new Vizio's that are coming out in a few weeks).  I don't want to sound like a bitter person ("I'm never buying Samsung again!!!") but I have to admit this experience has soured me on the brand.  Their customer support and their software development is just terrible.  I'm downgrading this to two stars as the picture/sound are indeed good on this TV but the SMART features... not so smart!!

Reviews.Title: Wifi and sound issues
Reviews.Author: Gotham Observer "porkboy"
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I'm a former employee of Samsung. I know they make incredible electronics, I've seen the glowing customer reviews on samsung.com, I've owned quite a few of their products and loved them, but this TV is not meeting expectations. I'm also a web marketer by trade and have a background in internet tech support. I'm tech savvy and I know what I'm doing.First, the good parts. The picture is great. Set up is easy. The menus are so much easier to understand than other TVs I've wrangled with. External media via USB works well.  I bought a Samsung DVD player too and they pair with the same remote which is a nice bonus. All that is great. I have two major complaints.1- Sound. I have a set of computer speakers that I plugged into the mini jack audio out of the TV. You cannot control the external speakers with the TV remote by this method. Since my computer speakers do not have a remote it means I have to get up and walk across the room to turn the volume down or just use the TV speakers which are pretty worthless due to the nature of every flat screen TV - they must have the speakers in the back by design. I contacted Samsung support and they confirmed that the mini jack audio out is a fixed volume and cannot be altered with the remote.2- Wifi. Maybe I have a dud, but as a wireless device this TV is pointless. I don't have cable TV. I don't watch broadcast TV. I use Netflix, Hulu and Amazon almost exclusively for video entertainment. This means a solid connection to the internet is a must. The TV has major issues with my wifi. I have troubleshooted this issue in every way I know how: network settings, rebooting cable modem and router several times, starting the devices in order from modem to wifi router to TV. I even added 50 ft. of ethernet cable to get the wireless router to just 4 feet away from the TV itself. I then tested the download speed using speedtest.net on the TV's web browser. My laptop, also 4 feet away from the wifi router, measures 14 mbps download speeds. The TV at the same time registers 300 kbps - about 1/40th the speed. As a result none of the streaming video apps work reliably. I wind up going back to watching on my laptop like a student in a college dorm. This defeats the entire purpose of why I bought this TV in the first place. Samsung support suggested I turn off all other competing wifi devices in my home so there's no competition for the signal. Well, ignoring that this is not a viable solution for web device addict like myself (2 laptops, a tablet and two wifi enabled smartphones) this didn't work.UPDATE: I bought a $30 wifi range extender that has a ethernet port out. I connected that to the TV with a hard cable into the LAN port of the TV to bypass the wifi antenna and this has improved things greatly.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, smart hub bug, wall mount issue
Reviews.Author: Matthew D Muller
Reviews.Content: ===OVERALL===This is my third Samsung LED and I found the picture to be as good as that of my UN46D7000 (higher-tier 2011 model).  Supposedly this set can't do micro-dimming.  But you wouldn't know it from the black levels, which are as good as or better than the D7000's, lending the F5500 great picture depth.  Overall this is a solid performer where it counts, and in a nice-looking package.  Very good value for this price point.  As noted below, the power cord connector protrudes from the back enough that it might interfere with a low profile mount.  And some of the smart apps didn't work out of the box.  There are workarounds for the first issue and as for the second, I expect Samsung will fix the apps with an update soon.===DESIGN===Most of this is evident from the photos.  The bezel is glossy black and the screen is matte with an anti-reflective coating.  It has a gray plastic Samsung emblem at the bottom center that looks like it could be pried out if you wanted to for some reason.  There's also an IR receiver that protrudes about a centimeter from the bottom right corner.The rear ports are recessed and side-facing, perfect for wall-mounting.  Unfortunately, the power cord socket faces straight back and is not recessed.  So the cord when inserted is not flush with the back of the set.  It has a T design that lowers the profile a bit, but when inserted still protrudes about .65 inches.  That's a bit more than some slim wall mounts (e.g. the picture-hanging style mount with a .5 inch mounting depth).  I shaved part of the T-connector tip and insulation off with a razor to get it down to .5 inch. So far nobody's been electrocuted.The base is satin graphite-colored plastic (some similar-looking Samsung bases are metal; this one's not).  You really have to torque in the screws when attaching it (tried this before wall-mounting).By the way, if you inexplicably can't seem to turn the thing on, try the master power button at the bottom right back of the unit.  Turns out this works much better than throwing the remote at it.===SMART FEATURES===Set-up is easy with the built-in wifi.  The interface is intuitive and not tough for non-techies to figure out.  There do seem to be a few bugs.  Several of the apps (e.g. Netflix, YouTube) prompt you to update the unit's software before proceeding.  However, when you do the update check (hit menu and then look under the support submenu), it advises that everything is current.  So I haven't been able to use at least two of the apps, as of firmware version 1013.  Hopefully Samsung fixes that quickly.  Amazon and Hulu work fine.The apps aren't snappy-fast but also not turtle-slow.  Unless you really want these things to pop, you probably won't miss the quadcore processor.No problems hooking up a Logitech wireless mouse and keyboard. You have to enable it under a menu but otherwise it's plug-and-play.The web browser works well.  Not super-fast but quite usable.===AS A COMPUTER MONITOR===I/ve hooked this up to a Macbook Air for use as a monitor.  So far I haven't figured out the right mix of settings to get the desktop to display without scaling/underscan/overscan that leaves text blurry and images a bit off (try setting your computer monitor to something other than its native resolution if you're not familiar with this effect).  Selecting "screen fit" for picture size at least seems to get the desktop properly fitted on the screen (16:9 will scale it).  But the text is still fuzzy.Sometimes settings for a particular input are optimized by default for use with a computer (usually they're marked something like "HDMI 3/PC" or "HDMI 4/DVI").  I tried all of them, no change.  I turned off all motion smoothing and other picture processing.  No luck.  I tried various configurations on the Mac display menus.  Still no go.  It's not clear whether the issue is on the Samsung or Mac side.  It might be fine with a PC.I'll try to post an update if I figure this out.

Reviews.Title: Quite Stunning Video and Audio
Reviews.Author: Thomas Krafft "thomaskrafft"
Reviews.Content: This is not my first high definition set, but it is my first smart TV--40 inches makes it the largest I've owned--and I am duley impressed so far. What drew me to this set was the very thin frame or bezel around the screen which obviously gives a larger picture in a smaller space.The technical specs and capabilities are well described on the product page, so I won't repeat them here. I want to give you an idea of my experience with the set, the things I was surprised by, and what you may not otherwise find out.The set-up was the easiest experience I've had so far with the TV guiding me through the process before I even had to find the Menu or Guide buttons on the remote. The ports are plenty and well marked leaving a minimal wire profile and a clean look.The remote control is pretty well marked and easy to follow, though not as tactile to use in the dark as the Dish Network control. The Samsung's remote, however, is backlit so it doesn't need to be particularly tactile.I very much like the fact that the base is not a large, flat, glossy black surface as most sets have been in the last few years, showing the first specks of dust and never staying clean for very long. This stand is four curved grey legs that are elegant and practical from a cleaning point of view.The sound quality is especially good with broad range and deep, unmuttled lows. Every manufacturer claims good fidelity, but this set actually provides it. My dog reacts to the slightest animal sounds as if they were right in the room.There were only pros in my experience and no cons (if that changes I will update this post) and I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung makes great TV's that are best in their class
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Cowen
Reviews.Content: Samsung makes great TV's that surpass every other manufacturer in their class. I have two Samsung's in my house and I can tell you the image is beautiful. This TV has an LED screen and in my opinion this the way to go (LED is similar to LCD its back-lit better so that they are no dark spots on the screen).Now add in that this TV can directly connect to the internet and I'm sold. TV's of this class have never been cheaper.One thing that I have found with TV's that its very important to actually look at the TV in person. Now when you look at the TV's, go to a place like Walmart to see them, because many times specialty stores like Best Buy play with the lighting controls on the TV and in the store to skew the image to there advantage. Once you look at the TV simply look and decide which one looks better to you.The next step to take into consideration is features. Here are a few that come with this TV:This Samsung comes with Auto Volume which automatically adjusts the volume of the desired channel, lowering the sound output when the modulation signal is high or raising the sound output when the modulation signal is low. This reduces the difference in volume when changing channels. The Auto Volume feature can be set to Normal, Night or Off.As far as outputs most of these TV's will come with more than enough Inputs and Outputs. This TV comes with 3 HDMI Audio/Video In, 1 RCA Component Audio/Video In and 1 Digital Coaxial Audio Out.Next thing when shopping for a TV is in box technology. Here are some of the features of this TV:With this Smart HDTV there is a full web browser with WiFi built-in apps made for TV. Some of the apps this TV features is Hulu Plus, YouTube, Netflix, Facebook, and Twitter. Browse the web while you watch movies and TV shows, and enjoy TV while you chat with friends and family online, all on one screen with this Samsung.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.

Reviews.Title: awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Alla S.
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality and sound. It was easy to set up and to connect to wifi with the wireless modem. I love the look of the tv and how it's situated on a four-leg stand. When you turn it on, you get an attractive menu with one tv channel playing in a small window, and a bunch of other channels lining up at the same time. You can then enlarge the channel currently playing, or to switch to any of the other channels. Definitely have the HD box hooked up to the tv for some terrific picture quality.Besides the "on tv" section which is automatically selected when you turn on the tv, the menu interface includes other categories like "movies and tv shows," "photo/video/music," "apps" (that's where you get the web browsing, as well as access to facebook, netflix, amazon instant video, twitter, youtube, skype as well as a bunch of other less known apps), and lastly a fourth category called "social" (not sure of its purpose, as you can just use the apps for that).One thing I really liked is that I noticed the screen automatically adjusts itself to its surroundings--if the room is bright the tv is bright, if I turn off the light and the room is dark, the picture becomes dim as well. Great sensors.Now to some things that could be improved: If say I lose my remote control and need to turn on the tv manually, I have to actually bend over and reach all the way behind the tv to locate the joystick-like button that turns it on and controls it. This is inconvenient. Also, when I turn on the internet, I have found that it's uncomfortable to do the typing with the remote control pointer. I have remedied this issue by purchasing the logitech k400 wireless keyboard, which was easy to set up and I noticed works well with this tv. Lastly, and a minor annoyance with the otherwise superb design, is that while the brand name "samsung" is often directly imprinted on its products, here it sticks out separately, underneath the monitor, like some kind of cheap tag that you keep wanting to tear off, before suddenly remembering that it's attached to the tv.Overall though, this is the best smart tv on a budget, that has almost everything that the more expensive models have. The only thing lacking is a camera (that's if you want to use skype, but it would cost way less to purchase one separately and hook it up to this tv, than to buy a more expensive smart tv model where the camera is included).

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: E. Sung
Reviews.Content: Great TV!I mainly used it for netflix/hulu/amazon/youtube streaming and it works great.  It reads my portable hard drive quite well too.  The picture quality is great and the apps work awesome so far.  I tried the web browser with the remote and it was painful, I would definitely invest in a keyboard (perhaps the logitech k400r - usb) if I was going to browse the web with it.Sound: won't blow your socks off, but super solid  4/5Picture Quality:  very sharp, a little bit bright.  4.5/5Smart Features: pretty much everything from skype to hard drives to wireless network setup.  5/5Aesthetic Look: Very Pretty, slim bezel 5/5If I had to buy another TV tomorrow, I would easily choose this one again.  It is a well though out tv.  It has everything you want from a smart hub (web, youtube, streaming, skype, keyboard, usb hard drive, wireless network) and the integration is great.p.s. this is for the 40"  5500 model.*****Update******If you want to use skype, you have to use on of Samsung's cameras which will add another $80-130.  For the web browser, it can't download anything or install any plugins.I love the tv for the netflix, hulu, and amazon apps.  So I'm sticking  with the 5 star rating.  If you are really looking for skype and lots of web browsing, I would down it to 4 stars.Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Sounds Great
Reviews.Author: Ortipus
Reviews.Content: The setup was a nightmare (ended up buying a CAT6 Ethernet cable -- the WiFi wouldn't fly). But once it was up and running, I could not believe how great music streaming from Pandora sounds coming from the speakers built into the TV (which we have mounted on the wall). I was going to hook up external speakers and amplifier  -- I actually did, but dig this: the TV's built in speakers sound better! The picture is good, color good. A few glitches with the "Smart" features. But overall I am satisfied.

Reviews.Title: This F5500 HDTV was so good we returned it...for the 40 inch model!
Reviews.Author: Olaf Johnson
Reviews.Content: I was deciding between the EH5300 and the F5500 but was not sure what the differences were other than price. The F5500  series is about $200 more retail and from appearance looks to have an X shaped stand with a much slimmer side profile than the EH5300. In fact last Christmas we bought my mother a pair of 32 inch EH5300s for her kitchen/bedroom and those TVs were awesome. So I assumed the F5500 was just a newer slimmer stlyish series to the cheaper EH5300 when I picked one up last week from Best Buy for my fiance's birthday.Man was I wrong about it just being a slimmer TV. The UN32F5500 is a BEAST!!!! First and foremost when you hook it up and turn it on the quality of the surround sound is what hits you first. The sound that comes out of this little 32" guy is crystal clear and super loud (be sure to set it for MOVIE Mode). It literally feels as if the scene on TV is going on in your room. The trick is the speakers on the F5500 are on the bottom edge of the monitor so mounting it on a flat wall helps project the sound even better. By contrast the EH5300 has poorer sound quality.The F5500 is a slim and thin TV that weigh far less than the chunky steel wall mount anchors that I screwed on the back of the thing. This is good but also can be bad if you want your TV to make a bold statement in the room you mount it in.If you are replacing an older beefier wall mounted 32" flat screen (the older TVs had 2 to 3 inch thick bezels with 4 ot 5 inches of bezel on the bottom edge for speaker grills and buttons) with this F5500 the first thing you will think is the F5500 screen is smaller on the F5500. This optical illusion is a result of the micro thin bezel that surrounds the F5500's display. It makes the entire package appear tiny on a big wall. This is why we returned the 32 inch F5500 for the 40 inch version. As a matter of fact the 40 inch F5500 has the same wall mount footprint as our old 32 inch Dynex Flatscreen.With everything said and done when it comes to Samsung HDTVs you already know you are getting great picture quality and with this F5500 you will not be dissapointed.As for the SMART TV features I believe Samsung does a great job with providing many apps and making the interface easy to access and really fast. The Netflix and Smart Hub shortcuts on the remote is super helpful. You can also program the F5500's remote control to control your cable box. If you have other Samsung or Andriod devices in the house then you can connect everything to this TV.Overall this is a great TV. We expect it to be on the walls for years to come.

Reviews.Title: the tv is great
Reviews.Author: Erich
Reviews.Content: I have only had the tv for a few months, setup was fantastic, simple, picture is so clear, I enjoy watching programs on it

Reviews.Title: Great! This is almost an oversized Tablet... Love this TV and it's multiple functions.  SMART!
Reviews.Author: H. Hill
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I am your average Jane Doe TV viewer, with an above average ability to manage my network, etc.; however, I'm not an audiophile, and the lighting issues I've read about haven't been an issue with me.  The software is a little cumbersome but it's intuitive and simple to figure out.  I've not even looked at the manual yet, and when I do I may learn some easier ways of managing around the various menus.  But seriously, putting all that aside, I LOVE THIS TV!  This is my 3rd Samsung in the last 3 years (for different rooms) and they keep getting smarter.  The network connections were easy, I've been able to log into my Amazon and YouTube accounts easily, Pandora was simple too.  Geez, this thing is almost an oversized tablet with all the apps that are built in.  DirecTV was as easy connection, I've added a wireless mini-keyboard that I wasn't using and a wireless mouse.  Both of these have made manuevering around the menu's easier than the remote.  The remote is cumbersome, but intuitive, thus the keyboard and mouse.  The networking connections were done easily on first try, because it was found quickly.  That 26 key PW is a PITA with the remote.  The sound is fine for me, the picture is fine for me, and all the preloaded apps will keep me busy for quite a while as I go thru those.  I really love this unit and hope it continues to perform as well as it is now.

Reviews.Title: Great! IR Extender is actually helpful
Reviews.Author: Art
Reviews.Content: I won't rehash what the other reviews have stated, but this one is truly a smart tv. Having been a Sony fan for so long, I was hesitant to switch brands but did so after friends raved about Samsung TV's. What has been truly outstanding about this TV and this ability to incorporate basic Set-Top-Box functions into the Samsung stock remote. I can now finally say I can control all my home theater appliances with a single remote! Just note, the IR extender that comes with the TV needs to be placed a foot or so in front of the device you are trying to control and not anywhere else; if you don't do that (and place it far away from the device to-be-controlled), the Samsung remote can't assume control of the box.Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Pitfalls of edge-lit LED screen
Reviews.Author: N
Reviews.Content: Overview:  an annual update to UN32EH5300 smart TV.  Dual core makes everything snappy.  Despite the quality Samsung panels, though, uneven lighting is noticeable.Pros:  solid quality, smart TV with apps you would actually use, adequate amount of ports, solid design, good viewing angle, high energy efficiency, setup is relatively painless and scans all the channels for you and hides all the scrambled ones.Cons:  edge-lit LED as opposed to last year's full array LED, uneven lighting with bright edges and dark corners, some apps are unoptimized and hard to navigate as well as providing lower streaming quality than a Roku box, remote doesn't have QWERTY buttons like Vizio's, stand is only ideal if you're putting it on a solid pane as opposed to wire shelf or other less-than-ideal footing, bezel not very thick despite utilizing edge-lit LED.In a nutshell:  two steps forward, one big step back.Everyone has priorities.  When it comes to TVs, I have priorities as well.  High resolution is nice, but not necessary. Size matters, but in that it should match the location it's going to be at.  Smart TV is good to have, but it's nothing a Roku box can't solve.  But I game. I like pretty pictures.  So my interest lies in low input lag, good color reproduction, and nice, even lighting.  Looking at the reviews on many TVs, I settled on this one.  I actually went out to a big-box retailer and got a Samsung-paneled one (Samsung is apparently notorious for mixing and matching different manufacturer panels on same models, with wildly different picture reproductions and such. You should read up on it).It's all pretty good.  The stand "legs" are unorthodox but fashionable, and TV is constructed well.  It has 3 HDMI ports--pretty sure that's about how much I need.  Colors are good, setup was painless, and it has audio-out AND Ethernet-in.  It's great.But it has its downsides.  From old model, they have decided to make the TV thinner by switching from full array LED to edge-lit LED.  Now, what that does is moving all the light source from the TV from directly behind the LCD panels to the edges of it via light guides.  Think of it like, say, a Kindle Paperwhite, except in reverse and with much stronger light.  In theory, it'll work just as well as full array.  Nope; it usually ends up in corners being dim and edges being brighter than the center.  And that's exactly what happened with this TV.  It functions, it's beautiful, and smart TV function is actually usable thanks to a substantial hardware upgrade.  But I have slightly different priority, which makes its cons cut a lot deeper than others.You're a sexy beast, Samsung, but the bright and dark spots of yours bug the hell out of me.  I've just ordered its slower, older sister to see if it makes a difference.  Two TVs come in, one leaves as a return--wish me luck.

Reviews.Title: Best Picture I've Seen in This Class of TVs
Reviews.Author: The Travelin' Hrncirs
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time going between 4 and 5 stars.I like this TV a lot - I really do. I am stationed in Mexico, but ordered it from Amazon when I found it at a Walmart here for about $150 more. So we waited a couple of weeks and I eagerly took it out of the box.First of all - our stuff comes through USPS and then a second mail forwarder, and it still arrived in perfect condition. I was a bit concerned, but it's clearly packed well.As far as operation, I was impressed by the buttons for Netflix and Amazon Prime Video, but unfortunately only the Netflix works here. The Amazon Prime clearly does not work out of the US - even just south of the border. Ironic since they sell this model here...The setup is fairly intuitive (initially all menus were in Spanish because I'm in Mexico - but that fixes itself). Trying to use Facebook is a pain because you have to create a Samsung account. I assume that means that if my wife and daughter and I all wanted to use this TV for Facebook, we would have to create separate Samsung accounts and log in and out. We opted not to use that feature, mostly because who wants to create another account (Samsung) to log into an account you already have (Facebook).The TV updates its own firmware, but that takes quite a bit of tie when you start up... Even though my internt connection is not too bad (20-30mbs on average).I thought Skype was going to be awesome for the big screen, and frankly was a huge selling point on this model (besides having the best picture in the store), but only when it arrived did I read that in order to use Skype, you have to buy one of their 2 specific models of webcam. The webcam that I plugged into the USB port (that says WEBCAM) was not compatible. Only two webcams on earth are compatible apparently, but luckily I can buy it on Amazon for $80 with free shipping for Amazon Prime Customers. A bit of a turn-off.I do like the fact that I can plug an external hard drive in and play right from that. So far I've had only one issue with a file that would not play (.mkv files play amazingly well), and there's a chance that it's a problem beyond the control of the TV - so for all intents and purposes - it plays everything I threw at it.There is a screen mirroring feature that sounded awesome (playing video on your screen from your smartphone) but then I discovered that this of course is only available with some Samsung Phones. Which was a bit of a downer... If this had that same ability from an iPhone app - I imagine it would expand their audience... but I'm sure there are compatibility issues there.The single biggest complaint that I have about the quality of this TV is that when I connect it from the Computer to the TV via a HDMI cable (does not matter which HDMI port on the TV), sometimes (not all the time) the TV starts to emit a horrible humming noise. It happened the first day I set it up and I thought maybe it was the cable. I plugged it in again the second day - no noise. Just now, as I was writing this review, all of the sudden it spontaneously came back and would not stop until unplugged. It might be the cable, but I never had this problems with my last TV. I did have it hooked up to a laptop for a brief while (2 episodes of Breaking Bad) and I did not experience this problem, but again - for 4 years I had this same computer hooked up to a different computer and never had the same hum. Clearly a compatibility issue.I was pleasantly surprised to see that it discovered my wireless laptop on the network and offered to play files, but it didn't work smoothly. I don't plant to use it for this purpose often, but it was frustrating that it could't play a couple of video files without giving me a network error message. I also wish it would recognize the lan connected cable instead of just wireless shared files.The App Store from Samsung is lacking. It's okay, but most of which I have no interest in. My turn-off from Facebook was referenced above, and I didn't bother to set up twitter because I'm not likely to go through all those steps when it's one click away on my phone. Skype is worthless unless I buy a camera from Samsung. And really - the rest is boring, or a link to buy something else. The App store is not a selling point, unless you count Netflix as an app - which is the only saving grace on this machine... Although, I am pretty sure we'll buy the stupid camera because I really like the idea of all sitting around the TV instead of sitting around the Computer.So I've said several negative things about it - but the reason I was torn... I LOVE THE PICTURE. It's really fantastic. In the store compared to all the other similarly-sized TVs in the store. I mean the picture wasn't close (to be fair I'm sure it would have had more competition in a Best Buy than in a Walmart). Getting it home and playing digital files, I am NOT disappointed. Watching episodes off of Netflix is not the epitome of High Definition (I was playing via a hard wire connection. not wireless) but comparable to my computer monitor - just bigger. My cable box has not been properly set up so my cable comes in as standard definition, but it's still very good. I can't wait to turn on the HD channels. So all and all, for the size of the box, the picture could not be better in my mind. I am very happy with the picture and quality.In the end I determined that my disappointment with unit's shortcomings were a bit too much to overcome, despite being the best picture I've ever had in my living room. At this point I would definitely buy again (I've seen nothing else in this price range that compares) and would recommend this TV to all but my geekiest friends who would expect more out of a SmartTV.TL;DR: Best Picture ever, rest of the apps and features leave a little to be desired.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, EXCELLENT INPUT LAG, poor smart features.
Reviews.Author: Jay Thornock
Reviews.Content: Bought this 50" TV from Sam's club as well as a 2012 46" model.  Compared them side by side to decide which to keep.  Input lag on the F5500 matched the EH5000, which is best in the industry.  Around 20-23ms of lag, when game mode is enabled.  Tons of lag without game mode, so watch out.  Contrast and brightness, as well as color accuracy, are excellent for this price range.  Ran the same show on an Apple TV and the Smart TV netflix to the two sets at the same time in order to do a comparison.  Thought the 50" video quality was extremely poor.  Plugged the Apple TV into the 50" F5500 and the picture was dramatically improved.  Not sure why, but the picture quality of Netflix streaming via the built in wifi and smart TV app is just garbage.  Could not believe how bad it was.  I am keeping the set because of the great open box deal I got.  Otherwise, I would buy the F5000 and get the same screen and picture quality and buy a separate external smart TV solution like a ROKU box or Apple TV.  Then it can be used with other screens too, if necessary.  Honestly the worst streaming quality I have seen.  The resolution was there, it wasn't downgrading the signal for bandwidth, but the colors, contrast, and detail were all wrong.Side note:Already mentioned low input lag.  Just need to state that this is, in my opinion, one of the best sets of 2013 for gaming.  Able to turn off almost all video processing, super low input lag, very good contrast and color accuracy result in a great gaming experience.  Some people will say, "What about 240 HTZ sets?!"  Your Xbox or PS3 is only outputting 60 htz.  The 240 htz sets may have a better pixel response time, which will reduce motion blur on fast action, but 60 htz and 240 htz guarantee nothing in regard to this pixel black to white to black response time.  I have had no motion blur problems while gaming on this set.  The response time seems to be perfectly adequate, though I admittedly have never really been bothered by motion blur on any of my sets and do not have an exact measurement.  Input lag is what I despise and this is one of the very few sets that will get you into the low 20ms range while maintaining a very respectable picture.  Only small computer monitors have less lag and many computer monitors still have more.  I also own a Dell S2440L with a sub 10ms input lag response and cannot clearly  feel a difference.  Amazing response time for a large 50" screen.

Reviews.Title: Nice second TV
Reviews.Author: Shane O'Neill
Reviews.Content: I won this TV in a sweepstakes giveaway and replaced a Sony NSX-24GT1 Google TV. It is a second TV, and it lives in my bedroom about 10 feet away from my viewing position. It is a fine TV, some of the reviews are a bit harsh in my opinion. Compared to the Sony Bravia picture I'm used to the Samsung is much brighter, vivid, clearer, and the blacks are definitely what I would expect and not dark grey. The TV as a Smart TV does have some drawbacks but as a whole is definitely worth the money if you were to buy this.I primarily use this set to stream Netflix, Hulu, and my iTunes library of movies through an Apple TV. My only other use is watching DVDs or Blu-ray Discs.Pros:TV is very light, easy to moveBright, clear picture in standard, 720p, 1080pRich colorsVibrant sound for a small room, even at volume setting 8.Music was slightly overpowering at first until I turned on the True settings. The voices in the streamed movies and TV shows I was watching sounded clear/acceptable. It filled my 16 1/2' by 12 1/2' bedroom with ample sound even at lower volume settings.Picture is clearly visible from everywhere in my room, some LED TVs get dark or blurred when you are at extreme angles.Samsung Apps seems to offer quite a lot of video and educational apps. Gaming on a TV doesn't make sense to me, but if that is your thing, then they have that as well.Refresh was perfect in 1080p with some of my larger files, but then again I was streaming through the Apple TV and not using the processor of the TV as much.The TV resembles a PC LED Monitor, I personally like that since it makes the unit a little less obtrusive. For instance, I have mine sitting on top of a dresser instead of hanging it where the Sony used to be.Turning the unit on; it loads fast (My Sony Google TV took almost a minute, sometimes more to load completely)Cons:Smart Hub is not so smart.TV configuration is okay, entering text is very cumbersome. I've seen worse but it could have been better.First-use configuration is looking for you to attach cable or antenna. It didn't give me an option to skip and I really think it should have.The remote is nothing fancy considering it is a smart tv.The base seems stable but as some have stated it does look and feel a little cheap. In my opinion it doesn't look like the base of a TV and therefore the feel is wrong.The WiFi disconnected on the TV the first two times I tried updating the system software. It has been fine after the update dated Aug 2013.My overall impression is that this TV is 4 1/2 stars for picture and sound quality, take away a little for the cumbersome uninspiring Smart TV interface and remote. My out of box experience was positive, the TV set up fast with very minor tweaking to get it the way I wanted it. My Apple TV and Blu-ray plugged right in with no further manipulation. The remote control for the TV is less inspiring however perfectly acceptable for general TV usage. The overall build and feel of the TV is really quite pleasing considering the retail price. I am pleased with the quality of the picture and sound and it makes a wonderful replacement for my 24" Sony Google TV.

Reviews.Title: better picture than the vizio but having wifi issues
Reviews.Author: Gregory Bryan
Reviews.Content: So, if you are reading this review I'm assuming you are trying to pay a little less than $400 for a solid 32 inch LED TV.  For most people, that leaves you with this TV or the VIZIO M321i-A2 32-Inch.  If you go to best buy and are lucky enough to have these two TVs close together you will see that the Samsung absolutely destroys Vizio in the picture department.  To be honest, it's not even close.  The colors are so much more vibrant on the Samsung TV.  I tried many different settings on both TVs and at different Best Buys and the Vizio colors just look dull next to this Samsung.  With all of that said, the smart TV feature is also a very important component of this purchase.  I am not going to go into the plethora of things I have done with samsung tech support and my internet provider, but this TV consistently drops off the network.  My apple TV is sitting directly under this TV and has not dropped off the network while streaming once in the last year since I bought it and every single device in my house has no problem holding a connection.  You may ask why I still keep my Apple TV and the reason is because I feel I get much better quality streaming with Apple TV with absolutely no hiccups.  The only thing is that I also have amazon prime and would like to stream movies from that app, and I can't do that with apple products "yet." Thus, one of the reasons I bought this TV was to have access to these other streaming apps like Amazon.  I feel confident saying that it is a hardware issue with the TV.  I will continue to try and troubleshoot this issue, but sending this TV back to Samsung is honestly going to be such a hassle just to get amazon prime streaming.  It could very well be that I need to extend my signal even though it's only 20 feet from my router and NO other devices in my house have problems connecting.  But, I saw one other person on these reviews who had success with this. I will update this if I fix the issue.

Reviews.Title: Best Buy in the 32" Class
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: I'm not really a LCD fan because the picture quality of the technology is inherently inferior to plasma.  But at the 32" size, LCD is the only choice, and I must say I'm pleased.  When I compare the picture and features of this model to its competitors, there was no comparison except a Sony going for an outrageous $200 more.  The Sammy itself is pretty pricey for its class.  But you get what you pay for.  Samsung's Smart Hub is hands down the best of the smart TV platforms, and the picture quality is top notch, as is the nice little extra of including an IR blaster to control your other devices hooked up to the TV like a cable box, DVD players, etc.  Tell it who your cable or satellite provider is and it'll create its own program guide for you that in some cases will be better than your provider's.  It will also make recommendations for you to watch.  The more you use it, the more it learns what you watch and changes the recommendations for you.Yes, you can pay less to get a 32" LCD Smart TV from Vizio, Toshiba, LG, etc.  But go do a side by side comparison of picture quality and features, and you'll see the difference.  Like I said, you get what you pay for.  Samsung makes one 32"  model higher than this, the 6300 series, which I don't see as being worth its $130 price premium.  Near as I can tell all you get is an extra HDMI input, a 120 hz refresh rate, and Clear Motion Rate 240 instead of this model's 120.  Clear Motion is Samsung's term for a bunch of electronic trickery that attempts to mimic a 120hz or higher refresh rate.  But make no mistake, the 5500 is really a 60hz panel, while the 6300 is really 120hz.  Setup was easy and everything worked as it should.  Hooking up to my Wi-Fi was a breeze and streaming videos on Amazon and HBO Go works great with no buffering.  I recommend calibrating the display to get the most of out it.  Just Google a review of it to find professionally calibrated settings.I do have a few quibbles: though the blaster works well, controlling my cable box with ease and little delay, be advised that Smart Hub is not designed to operate a DVR, so you'll still be stuck using  a separate remote if you have one.  Samsung dropped the ball there.  Also while the remote is backlit, it doesn't light up unless you press something.  But you can't see what to press in the dark.  They should have made it light up when picked up.  The button layout is not the best.  Often used buttons like play, fast forward, etc. are at the very bottom.  Dumb ergonomic design.  I'm not a fan of the quad stand either.  It's a bad design that simply takes up too much space compared to a simple rectangular stand other brands use.  The stand on this TV is 22" wide and 10.4" deep for an entire TV that only measures 29" wide.  By comparison, the stand for my far larger 58" plasma is only 24.5" wide.  The stand only rotates 10 degrees.  That is useless, barely moving it off center.  Why bother?  Lastly, though marketed as a 32", the screen measures only 31.5"  C'mon Samsung - I paid for 32", I expect to get every inch I paid for.  At least market the truth.In summary, the Samsung UN32F5500 is the best buy in its class if you want a smart TV.  It's on the upper end of the price range - but it's not the most expensive.  The ones that cost more don't offer anything to justify their price premium.  Meanwhile this model justifies it's premium over the models below it in price with its superior features, smart interface, and picture quality.  It's not perfect, as it's let down by Smart Hub's inability to integrate DVR functions, as well as a poorly designed remote and stand.  So I docked it a star.  But those minor issues aren't enough to keep me from recommending it.  If you don't want/need smart features, go with the 5300 series for about $50 less.  Happy viewing!

Reviews.Title: Great 32" TV...with some room for improvement

Reviews.Content: Has everything I want.PROS: Great picture.  Good "smart" interface.  Light weight.  Easy to use.CONS: To use Skype you need the Samsung camera.  I tried an old USB camera for a computer and it didn't like it.OTHER:  The remote is okay.  I suggest getting an inexpensive wireless keyboard (I paid ~$20 for a Logitech keyboard with touch pad).  It has an IR receiver that plugs into a USB port on the TV.UPDATE1: I find the web browser to be substandard.  It is exceptionally slow and I have trouble getting some webpages to load correctly. Well, that kind of makes the whole "SmartTV" feature irrelevant...no?UPDATE2: I find some apps like Amazon Prime, Amazon Cloud Player, Pandora, and TuneIn to work very well.  Since I use these apps a lot on my PC, it's great to see them work so well on my "SmartTV".UPDATE3:  I must say, if you watch Amazon Prime, this TV is exceptional.  I have my wireless router in the basement and the TV works flawlessly in my living room.  The Amazon Prime app is easy to use and delivers a fantastic picture and sound in HD.

Reviews.Title: Defective / Inferior product, lousy customer support
Reviews.Author: LF "justme"
Reviews.Content: First, just want to make a disclosure - i bought this TV from another site but wanted to share my review on his site as well. Based on past purchases, Amazon has been great and have no issues with them. The review is about the product.I bought this product back in December as a holiday present. Did not open it until January. It was working fine until couple of weeks ago. TV started power cycling (restarting) on its own. It can be while in a middle of a program or when just turning it ON. I initially called the vendor but was told that since it is more than 60 days, I will need to contact manufacturer. I called Samsung support. The tech advised to plug it a different outlet and upgrade the firmware. I followed their instructions but problem persisted. I was told to open a service request online. After couple of days, I received a voicemail instructing to perform same troubleshooting steps and that they will close the service request. I did it anyway and obviously did not work. Opened another ticket online. I got a call few days later and was being told the same thing. I told them that it has been done few times and that it does not work. I was told they will open a service ticket but I will need to bring it to their service center. I said that it is ridiculous and want a tech visit since it is not my fault and still new. I was told that they can send a tech out but I may have to pay for the repair. At that point I asked to speak with a manager. I was put on hold for at least 10 minutes then they hang up on me.I want to give them the benefit of the doubt that I probably just got a defective product but their customer service is so so bad that it makes me wonder if I want to purchase any other product from them with this experience.

I currently don't have cable subscription and I use the Smart hub exclusively, this has worked really well and everything is running smoothly, including the browser. Also, it's the only TV in my apartment and since all it needs in my case is electricity and wifi, due to its lightness and size (32-inch model), I can move it with ease from my living room to my bedroom if I feel like watching a movie before going to bed. The only thing that I find irritating is that clicking any remote control buttons will produce a sound. I'm sure or at least I hope this can be disabled but I still haven't tried to do it.

Reviews.Title: Difficult
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I have not had time to program my Samsung, but did want to leave a tip. I am a female, senior citizen. I am very active and do a lot of work around my house, mow and take care of a flower garden with no help. When attaching the plastic part of the base to the metal part I found it was almost impossible. There were no threads in the metal part of base and took every ounce of strength I had to get the screws through the metal.  I put the base on the floor, use both of my hands and full body weight to get the screws through the metal part of base. What on earth were they thinking when Samsung designed the metal base. Do they think the only people that purchase this product are male and twenty three years old? Had I known it would have been this difficult, I would have never purchased this television. I do like the picture and when I have time, think I will like the "smart" part of this television. Hope this is helpful to the seniors amoung us.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Xena's Mom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item, because most of the reviews were very positive.  The TV was nice, beautiful picture.  Everything I have come to expect from Samsung.  After 3 months, the screen suddenly went black.  I still had sound and could listen to what was on.  Tried everything.  Read the manual, did a reset.  Still no picture, just black screen.  Called Samsung.  After a good wait, the customer rep, kept coming back with more questions, putting me on hold every time.  Finally the rep came back, game me a ticket number, and told me a service technician would come to the house to service the TV, and someone would call me within 3 days to set it up.  Still no call.  Went back and looked at the negative reviews.  Some reported the same issue I have.  Obviously there is a problem with the set.  If you purchase this set, you may get lucky, then again you may be faced with the same issue.  I finally contacted Amazon, and the told them of Samsung's response, or lack of it.  Even though it was past their 30 day guarantee, Amazon said they would refund the purchase and even gave me a prepaid shipping label.  Thank you Amazon for stepping up and standing behind what you sell, even if Samsung would not.  Great customer service from Amazon, as always!

Reviews.Title: Avoid Samsung, they do not stand behind their products
Reviews.Author: Michael Nelson
Reviews.Content: I have purchased many Samsung products and have been very happy with them.  However, as I learned with this TV, if one has a problem, Samsung does not back their products with service.  I have spent hours on the phone with Samsung, have been handed off from one person to the next, each time I am told to try something else and to call back if the problem still exists.  The problem I am having is the TV turns itself off then back on and continues this behavior until unplugged.  If one does a Google search this problem will get many hits including information regarding a class action lawsuit due to this problem.  Still Samsung refuses to acknowledge the problem is real and to provide a resolution.  Given Samsung's unwillingness to accept responsibility for their problems, my recommendation is to avoid purchasing anything Samsung makes.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Daniel Geoly
Reviews.Content: when  I switch fron internet back to TV  picture is lost and source  goes to sreen mirror. I have to manually put it back on HDMI 1 to get picture. I was on the phone 2 hours with Samsung and they finaally admitted to me this was an ongoiing defect  in all these sets and they have not fixed it as yet. So I returned it  and am researching other sets, Samsung admits it I said.. Only in America At least Amazon is giving me full credit for the return of thid piece of junk

Reviews.Title: Bought 3 of these!
Reviews.Author: M. osullivan "maggieo"
Reviews.Content: These TVs are so wonderful that I bought one for our bathroom, one for our kitchen, and one for my mother-in-law.  The interface works wonderfully and the quality is great!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Brad Lee
Reviews.Content: I use this as a computer monitor.  The colors are not quite as good as what you buy as a computer monitor in electronics store, but good enough to make do.  The size is excellent for using as monitor 2-3' away.

Reviews.Title: Wow! Look no further...this is the best 32 inch television on the market.  Just buy it.
Reviews.Author: c.peck
Reviews.Content: I have been using this tv for a week now in my den, I wanted something smaller with streaming capabilities.  I am blown away by the picture and sound.  Also, the streaming capabilities that Samsung has are incredible...it's like having a roku box built into the television.  Overall, easy set up, best picture, great streaming capabilities and good sound from a small television.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price!
Reviews.Author: David E Fusik
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching the TV that I wanted before I ordered this TV. I have not been disappointed. Excellent picture quality and features to match. I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung the only way to go!
Reviews.Author: Richard R. LaBarre
Reviews.Content: Everything I heard about the 5500 series from Samsung was spot on. The color and clarity is outstanding. The base and angle of swivel keep the light weight Flat Screen in a solid position. with all the extra features such as the 3 HDMI ports and wireless Internet along with its plug and play capabilities this set is worth the money going away!

Reviews.Title: the item fullfilled all my expectations
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Fernow
Reviews.Content: I will recomend all my friendsA good price for a smarttv in comparition to other tv'sEasy installation and start up

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: M Goebel
Reviews.Content: Wanted a Smart tv - have Roku and Ps3 for other tv's, but we were looking for a very specific place in our house.  The screen is great.  There are other reviews which help you maximize the screen colors, etc, so I advise looking at those.  This is a very clean, sleek look.  Thanks so much for putting the measurements on the review - height with and without the stand.  Came packaged very well, too.

Reviews.Title: Suit my needs
Reviews.Author: Innocent
Reviews.Content: I purchased this because I needed a new tv which was light, slim and compatible with all of my other Samsung electronics.  It's great fits into the required space perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up and use.
Reviews.Author: R Boyette
Reviews.Content: This is an extra tv that we don't use every day, however I like it so much that I find myself using it more and more.  The color is beautiful and I like that I can do a lot more with it besides just watch current programing on tv.  Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Price / Outstanding Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Bryan M.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this 40" model to replace an aging Vizio in our bedroom. De-boxing and set up of this TV was extremely simple - and it connected effortlessly to our wireless network. Netflix works great and the picture and sound quality are superb for this price point. Our biggest complaint (and the reason I can only give 3 stars) is that after about 3 days we had a pixel die (dark red) in the right center/middle of the screen. It's goes largely unnoticed when viewing active TV or movies - but when the screen is predominately dark/black it is clearly visible. Ultimately, this isn't enough of an issue to warrant returning or pursuing alternate brands but it will be something I continue to monitor like a hawk - I will not tolerate even one more pixel dying. Even at the great price we picked ours up at ($488), who wants to deal with the heartbreak of an imperfect product. Fingers are officially crossed!**UPDATE:On advice from my attorney/father I submited a complaint about the dead pixel - not in order to exchange it, but simply to have it documented in case more pixels decided to die.Shortly (near immediately) after submitting the complaint I received an e-mail response from the 3rd party vendor that sold me the TV - Video & Audio Center of Santa Monica, CA. Once seeing that my TV had shipped from across the country (I live in Ohio) I braced myself for a run-around - but that was ok, as I was just documenting the issue.Well let me say - Video & Audio Center went above a beyond any customer service experience I've ever had. Aside from responding to every e-mail I sent as quickly as one would expect from an instant message exchange - Video and Audio Center offered to send me a replacement TV upon simply providing them a picture of the defective pixel. Under this arrangement, I was never without a working TV; I was able to re-package the defective unit in the packaging provided by the replacement (since I had disposed of the original shipping box); and they agreed to pay for all the shipping costs so I was never out of pocket another penny.I have the new unit hooked up and couldn't be happier. All the pixels are in great working order and I couldn't be happier with both the TV and my experience with Video and Audio Center of Santa Monica. I'm sure Amazon strives to partner with great 3rd party vendors - and, in my experience, they couldn't have landed a better one in this case. Although I live on the opposite side of the country, I will go out of my way to do business with them in the future if at all possible.Upping to 5 stars because I think customer service this good is a rarity these days.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Locs
Reviews.Content: Im very pleased with my Amazon smart tv. The features and picture presentation is awesome. Im a prime member & with the click of a button I'm able to enjoy my movies and other cool things this tv has to offer. I feel I made a great choice....

Reviews.Title: Good picture, Good color, should've bought a 40"
Reviews.Author: "Tio Al"
Reviews.Content: I've had had this TV for 17 days now and it has worked perfect so far. I like that I can select different picture modes for different movies playing on different channels as the colors will vary. I got this TV mainly for the built-in Smart Hub which enabled me to connect wirelessly to my computers router to acquire my Netflix account, without any problems. I was also able to set up a free Pandora music station where I was able to save some of my favorite Mariachi radio stations and old school rock & roll stations. We use this in our bedroom where I have it connected to a Panasonic VHS/DVD Recorder combo player via an HDMI cable and it works great. In fact, before I even programed the universal remote, I tried playing a DVD disc using the Panasonic remote to open the players door to put the disc in & close it. I then tried using the Samsung remote select button (enter) and the movie started to play. I tried  the pause, forward, reverse, & stop buttons and they all controlled the Panasonic DVD player much to my surprise. I haven't had time to check out all the other features, but so far I am satisfied with the performance of the TV. I wish Samsung made a 36" or 37" size of this model as the 32" is a bit small for my eyes, considering our old one that burned out was a 37" Westinghouse, LCD, 14 year old TV. The color on this LED is far better than the Westinghouse LCD and the angle of viewing is better. I just wish  it will last as long. P.S. No more cable or direct tv for me.

Reviews.Title: Very new but so far no complaints
Reviews.Author: C. Bailey "Oasis Computers"
Reviews.Content: Well when I registered this TV it showed it was manufactured 11/30/13 so it's as new as you can get, apps all work sound is ok for speakers so small you may not see them "sound setting- Movie", wifi works great even though the adapter wont read a 802.11n @ 5 GHz signal I think there is a special adapter that will but running under 2.4 GHz is no problem buffering with Netflix, Youtube etc., the web browser that's built in works but it's slow and using HDMI from your computer is much better still to early to tell if I would get the big one for my living room.

Reviews.Title: Cannot say enough about this TV!!
Reviews.Author: AMann
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough about this TV.  I started out buying one from the living room.  After watching one movie on it I was hooked.  I am now buying one for every bedroom.  Using the smart features of this TV we haven’t touched cable in several months!  I bought this size for the bedrooms as Christmas gifts and think they will be very well received!

Reviews.Title: Love my TV, very crisp image and excellent sound.
Reviews.Author: justineleen
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. Just plug it in and really to watch. Very easy to set up wifi and Netflix, amazon prime Vudu. It has a very good sound. I just love it over my sony bravia and Vizio. I am thinking about getting a 60" now that I know the quality.

Reviews.Title: Great TV or display, very crisp, great sound, very light and compact
Reviews.Author: artrescue
Reviews.Content: Great TV or display, very crisp, great sound, very light and compact. Easy travels from room to room if necessary.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful product
Reviews.Author: Donald J. Wolcott
Reviews.Content: Very good looking TV and it worked as advertised.  Very smart and crisp picture.  A good product and would recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: awesome

Reviews.Content: I love this tv. It was the right size for my bedroom! Merry X-mas to me!I thought it was going to be too small. It is perfect!

Reviews.Content: Great, clear and crisp picture, nice feature set, reasonably priced.  Sound isn't great as with most flat screen TVs so I bought a soundbar to complement it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: An amazing television. Easy set up. Connected to my wifi with no problems. Works great with Netflix and Hulu Plus.

Reviews.Title: Stunning!
Reviews.Author: Brian H.
Reviews.Content: I love the picture on this TV. It is stunning! I'm kind of bummed I can't hook up a DVI connection to this TV and it doesn't have a  standard audio jack. My laptop is older so it doesn't support sound/video through HDMI, so that's how I watch hulu on my TV, but I'll just watch hulu on my desktop now. The pros far outweigh the cons with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Superb TV, will not disappoint you.  Better than my former LG 42LN5700 TV.
Reviews.Author: elvin
Reviews.Content: So far it's a great TV.  The 42LN5700 from Lg I purchased prior to this crapped out, so I switched.  I am glad I did.  The picture quality on both was about the same as far as clarity.  The Colors on the samsung stand out more though.  Also, this TV definitely wins if you plan to do some gaming.  The input lag is MUCH lower.  Its in the 27-30 ms range.  The LG has been clocked at 66-78 range which is pretty bad in comparison, and is noticeable in gaming.  The price is great on this tv for what you get.  Smart features are nice, and to the point.  You have your netflix/amazon buttons, etc.  The style of this tv is also much better than the LG I had.  This tv is nice and slim.  The stand is very stylish.  Highly recommend this TV.  IMO, the best tv in this price range and size.  The only real flaw Id say is the sound.  It's average, nothing great.  That's expected though.

Reviews.Title: like

Reviews.Content: Definitively the best option for its price. The app hub is outstanding, TV performance is really nice and image is crystal clear. Only Con I would mention is related to hz, it has only 60hz instead of 120hz (for instance), but in my case it is for my kids (2 years old and 4 month) so is OK.

Reviews.Title: Awsome TV
Reviews.Author: debskiluv "ski"
Reviews.Content: I love this Tv. Had a problem with wifi but it wasn't the Tv my router was more than 10ft so connections wasn't consistent. But connected the Tv to Phone modem and perfect no more loading everyday 2 seconds and connection is fast.Pro: picture, apps, featuresCon: sound not great

Reviews.Title: Great TV, just a couple of caveats
Reviews.Author: TVwithoutCable
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this TV except...I thought that I had read carefully enough to understand how the apps and the Internet worked but there are some subtleties that are keeping me from giving this product 5 stars.  While it is possible to use the web browser to "browse" the Internet, this does not include streaming videos from Internet sites such as hulu.com or cbs.com.  When I called Customer Service about problems I was having, I was told that this restriction has something to do with keeping out viruses.  It was disappointing, especially since the apps that are provided include HuluPlus but not Hulu.  The apps work great for the most part but be aware that just as it took a while for Android phones to amass a collection of apps, it will take time for this TV to do the same so you won't find everything you're looking for.  I'm hoping that with software updates the current shortcomings will go away over time.  Also, I have not tried streaming from my computer or smart phone to the TV - it's possible that this would be a way to get around not being able to access full episodes from sites for which there are no apps.  Otherwise, this is a great product -  the picture is great and I keep discovering cool features.  I am super satisfied with Samsung's Customer Service.  I've called twice and both times my call was answered by a capable, pleasant person almost immediately.  So, I am happy that I made the purchase and I definitely recommend this TV for the picture quality, the service, and the currently available features.

Reviews.Title: is fantastic.
Reviews.Author: J. A. D. N
Reviews.Content: this TV is excellent, the image is sharp, the package came in good condition, brought all that was offered. is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV - not great as a "computer".
Reviews.Author: Carolyn R.
Reviews.Content: It's a nice TV but using for things like Facebook really is awkward. Better to just use a computer for Apps like that.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: J "sonneillon"
Reviews.Content: For the price this TV is a great deal.  The only issue I have ran into all revolve around the remote that ships with the TV.  Either I got a defective remote or its a piece of crud. Reviews.Title: Love the smart tv

Reviews.Content: Unit arrived onetime and in perfect condition. Everything is really plug and play setup a snap. Just love the TV, if I had it to do over though I would have opted for a larger screen

Reviews.Title: Nice small TV at good price
Reviews.Author: Mark Trimmer
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace older 4:3 set that finally died.  Excellent price and good features. Easily connected to my home network and can stream Netflix and other services.  Only negative - user interface is sort of clunky.  Overall, a good TV for money.

Reviews.Title: Day 1 - DAY 4  LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: mariu
Reviews.Content: "DAY 4"After Day 1, on Day 2 I got it hooked up altogether, when not so tired.  The TV is awesome and so versatile.  If you aren't tech smart, get help with the hookup.  Looking back it was very easy to hook up, I was just too anxious and tried too hard.  The next day it came together totally!  I love the TV.  It's all screen with very little frame area so looks larger than tv's with 3 inch frames.  The Samsung Smart 32" has about a 3/4" frame."DAY 1"Unable to hook up my Comcast service with coaxil cable; so I've "ordered a HDMI cable", which should have come with the TV and did not.  4 of the screws went into the base stand but the others did not fit when attaching stand to TV and had to find screws I had at home with bolts on the back to get the stand on.  The TV looks great and the picture quality looks great with what Samsung has provided. I noticed 85% of the reviews were men!  This is not easy for a 69 year old grandma to hook up on her own.  Will add more later if I ever get it hooked up. I will call my cable provider and see if they can hook it up.  I'm extremely unhappy with how hard this is to hook up.  The menus do not say how to hook up cable TV.  The should have a training video on it.If I ever do get this hooked up I will write a better review I hope.  All the reviews were so positive except for a few.  I guess I'm one of the few.  The TV may be Smart, but this lady don't feel very smart! :(  (Read updated review at the top - give it a chance and don't be tired when hooking it up.)  Not hard at all on second try.  :)

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Dunyon "Shot"
Reviews.Content: Addicted to my tv! Incredible picture, Smart hub is very convenient, some of the apps are pretty cool and my ps3 has never looked better. The only issues are the low sound and I think calibration discs should come standard.

Reviews.Title: Great smart TV
