Reviews.Content: Excellent sound and image Quality. It has a very nice stand, so you don't need a wall stand except if you need some space. IT connects easily with an ipad, so you can use IT as a keyboard and mouse.

Reviews.Title: Smarter than me perhaps
Reviews.Author: Herms
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great buy. If you're looking to getting around purchasing an extra unit such as a blue ray or Xbox, this is perfect. Set up was really easy. Although Netflix has a hard time connecting right away sometimes but that could be anything. It's a great size especially for an apartment setting. If you love sound, I suggest adding a system.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price.
Reviews.Author: M. Tangney
Reviews.Content: The TV has a great picture. Styling is nice and slim. Sound is not great. I think it could benefit from better front facing speakers. I think if it was wall mounted sound would be a problem.  As well on a personal note I hate the sound affects produced with remote control usage. Not a flaw but I find it annoying. So it is a good deal and I am not unhappy but no competition for my Sony. However my Sony cost more than twice as much as this Samsung. So I feel I totally got what I paid for in both sets.

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: Keith Locke
Reviews.Content: Television is top of the line for a 32 inch. Picture is crystal clear and setup was easy. Screen mirroring is cool allowing mobile devices to display on tv screen wirelessly. I only gave 4 stars because the tv only worked 2 weeks and screen went blank. Samsung's service was not any help! They never responded to my service request. Amazon stepped in and picked up faulty unit and replaced it in 3 days. Amazon rocks!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Electronically  Challenged People
Reviews.Author: Dianne E. Socci-Tetro "Never Judge a Book by ...
Reviews.Content: I am truly computer challenged.  I went into the store and that was about the first thing I said to the salesman. I said, "Hi, I need a TV that does XXX and because I am 'Computer  challenged' (or computer illiterate, take your pick) I need  the simplest TV to set up and use, that there is out there."  And this is where the salesperson took me.  I had heard good things about the Samsung so I happily went with him.He encouraged us to try it - it could always be returned---we got it home and except for one minor glitch in setting it up, which called for my husband to use the eff word numerous times ( and the glitch was my husbands fault naturally ;-) ) it was the easiest thing we ever set up.  The TV pretty much does everything for you and the onscreen directions are so easy to follow.The fact that it has exactly what I needed built right in made this an even better deal for me...I was all set to have to set up my net-book or Kindle to be able to do some of the things that this TV is already programed to do.It (the TV itself) even managed to find our DVD player even though it's an older one, and set that up too.This is the perfect lower end TV for those of us that have not kept up with technology.  However, it is also the perfect TV for those rooms that don't require the best of everything.  Personally I don't beleive that there is a perfect piece of tech anywhere, but this comes close for the price.

Reviews.Title: amazing with only one flaw
Reviews.Author: jordan
Reviews.Content: This tv hase been extremely amazing. Smart hub is on point. Built in wifi works flawlessly.  Connects to my galaxy note 2 in a snap. Couldn't have gotten a better tv. Only flaw is when attaching to the base its super hard to screw it in.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV
Reviews.Author: Vance
Reviews.Content: I purchased this particular set because it has 3 HDMI inputs, analog audio out and digital audio out.  It has excellent clarity, color, black level and dynamic range in Movie mode.  Picture quality is very good with HD source material and quite decent with SD sources.  Motion blur is not objectionable.  Sound is much better than I expected - quite full and rich with excellent dialog clarity. You can easily add better speakers to the set for improved sound quality and expanded dynamic range.  I am very pleased with this set and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a high quality 32" TV.

Reviews.Title: Ilove it
Reviews.Author: Rodney de Carvalho
Reviews.Content: I love it. The set up is easy, fast and friendly. I recomend  the purchase the all.Beautiful design.Tks

Reviews.Title: Misrepresented capabilities
Reviews.Author: Northern Mom
Reviews.Content: The only reason I purchased this particular TV was for the Smart TV features, namely the ability to browse and use the internet to stream video.  The exact quote in the Samsung material "Full Web Browser:  All the benefits of full web browsing, right on your TV. From social sites like Facebook and Twitter to news, weather, entertainment, blogs and more. Discover even more content possibilities with your Smart TV."  I like to stream recent shows on my schedule so I use network sites like NBC.com and free Hulu.com often.  If you use the Samsung web browser app to navigate to hulu.com, it will not allow you to stream video content.  You can hear the video, but the screen will be black.  Same for NBC.com - no content streaming.  You can stream Hulu Plus from the Samsung created Hulu Plus app, but you cannot stream free Hulu through this app.  There are no apps for streaming other network shows like those on NBC.  The TV works fine as a TV and apps like Netflix work well, but "all the benefits of full web browsing" is not true.  I wish I had known, I wouldn't have spent $400 on this TV that doesn't do what it advertises.

Reviews.Title: Not As Good as it Looks! Samsung UN32F5500 32-inch LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Phantom
Reviews.Content: I am compelled to write this review for people to think twice before purchasing Samsung TVs. This is my third Samsung TV (different models) and all of them had issues. I have to admit their TVs look nice, but fail on the quality control, have cheap parts, and cease to perform within a relatively short period of time. The bottom line is -  it became a gamble to purchase this brand.Before listing the problems I've encountered, I want to mention that improper reviews lead to boosted ratings and potential customers are led to believe that problems are rare or isolated. Surely you've noticed this.I have not used this TV for smart features yet, but encountered the following issues:1.  The IR extender does not work properly. It tends to block the signal to the setup box, so the TV remote cannot be used to control both TV and the setup box.2.  If you plan to mount this TV on the wall be prepared to run around looking for the hardware and be creative.  The mounting holes on the back of the TV are different. Samsung said it was a defect. In reality, this model is made that way (3 holes with threading and 1 hole without threading) - there is absolutely no reason for that!3. This is a big one! After 6 months of moderate use, TV screen suddenly went black (no picture). The main panel (screen) was replaced. It was repaired under warranty. Needless to say,  you have to go through a torturous process to get it fixed.Now, on top of all the issues that customers have encountered, add Samsung's horrific Customer Service. Their lack  of knowledge, misguided information, complete disregard for the customers' time, and rudeness leaves you with only one  impression - they just don't care!  They have a big market share and will sell their junk to another victim. They don't care about the longevity of their products, because they want you to go buy another TV as soon as possible. How else will they sell the flood of TVs they throw out into the market if you keep yours for a long time? Think about it!Well, some of us can't afford a new TV every year! I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: What a picture!!!

Reviews.Content: Samsung great product matched with Amazon pricing made this a 'no brainer'  Saved $79 off of the big box stores and had this delivered in days.  This TV with the Smart option is a easy to use and just a great tv for the money.  Purchased an extended warranty through Amazon as well.  Would do all my TV buying through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: smart tv samnung
Reviews.Author: Earlie Saul
Reviews.Content: loved it because I can do everything with  this tv. especialy the Netflix my Pandora and my tv  shows . I liked to time when I could watch some of them come on at the same time.

Reviews.Title: great LED TV

Reviews.Content: This has been a great TV! I have cable via HDMI cable, along with Playstation 3 and 4 and wireless internet. It does everything well. The setup was easy and the remote controls my cable box just fine. I would highly recommend this TV. It has a great, crisp picture and seems to work well with both video game machines. Someone warned me against getting a TV that wasn't 240 HZ, but this works great with both Playstations and I don't even bother switching it to the game setting! Viewing sports on TV has no issues for me.

Reviews.Title: gift for fiance
Reviews.Author: Dana
Reviews.Content: I got this add a gift for my fiance and he loves it.  Wish it came with a keyboard but other than it is everything I expected.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Hswilliams
Reviews.Content: Fair warning, this is not an extremely technical review.  The package arrived on time and in good condition.  So far the TV has been great.  The picture is very clear and the apps and all the extras are great.  I wish the TV guide function worked better but that may have more to do with my cable provider than the TV.  I would definitely purchase this TV again.

Reviews.Content: I had not bought a.new TV in years. My old TV was a NEC that I loved. It had been in storage 4 about 3 years and unfortunately the sound was gone. So the hunt was on. The Samsung is great. The technology in this machine was unbelievable. I just love it. It's the best marriage of computer and TV.

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: terryoneal
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for a Christmas gift for my son and he absolutely loves it;  the picture is great; sounds pretty good and Amazon's customer services is Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: Just amazing
Reviews.Author: Raul R.
Reviews.Content: This tv has exceeded all my expectations.  The picture is exceptional as expected from Samsung and it is very light and slim as well,  but what has really impressed me is how it interacts with my cable service provider and simplifies finding upcoming shows and such.  It also has Netflix, Amazon Prime on the remote, and HBO GO directly on the user interface.  5/5.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price (32")
Reviews.Author: G. Rule
Reviews.Content: Amazing to get a 32" internet-connected Smart HDTV with built-in wifi for this price (roughly $350).Was easy to setup. Light and thin, stable base. Smart apps like Netflix and Amazon Instant Video are working great at good speeds. One guy said his came with no screws for attaching the base --I had trouble finding mine, but did eventually. Still not sure where they were originally, but digging thru the packaging I finally found the little bag they came in.Color and picture is great (once calibrated --google or look at the "most helpful" post upstream). Sound is much better than I expected from built-in sound. No, it's not home theater quality, but it is pretty darn good for two speaker built-in sound.Viewing angles are somewhat limited, so far as picture brightness and quality degrades once you get more than 20 degrees off center.  But that's not a problem for us, because this is our master bedroom TV (fits great on top of a 30" dresser!) so our "viewing position" doesn't change much!  If you need widely separated viewing positions, then probably this isn't your best choice.Really impressive piece of technology for the price (said the guy who paid $2,500 for his first HDTV in 2001).

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Rick Kearns
Reviews.Content: Great Smart TV.  Built in wireless Internet works great to watch any streaming movie.  Great picture and good 32 size.I like the thin TV

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40F5500 40-inch smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Sharon SUZY Bumeder
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how amazing this tv is to me. I have Time Warner Cable and can use this without the cable box for on demand and channels not normally available without a box. The picture is crisp and clear. The sound is great. I'm super happy with this purchase. I would recommend this tv. Apps are preloaded, you can add more and it has a full browser. I really haven't utilized the browser but have played around with it a little. Works great with Netflix and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Devo "2Fast4U"
Reviews.Content: Picture is fantastic and the sound is rich for a built in TV speaker.  It's not going to wow anybody but I'm not looking for a home theater in my bed room.  This is my second Smart TV set, and I find the software and interactive menu's much faster and easier to navigate than the Sony Bravia.  I admit, I almost always buy Samsung or Sony, so my opinion is biased.  Nothing wrong with LG, Toshiba or some of other top brands but I'm never disappointed in Samsung.  The picture is always great, they are reliable and design is 2nd to none.Update:After almost 2 weeks I am still very happy with this purchase.  I an easily browse the movies on my Windows HTPC and effortlessly change between channels and modes, the remote control is excellent.  However there's something I'd like to point out to Comcast/Verizon FIOS HD customers.  I had an issue with the HDMI signal refreshing several times an hour the screen would go black and I'd lose sound and the HDMI information would flash on the screen. Very annoying and from I understand a very common issue with Samsung and newer Set top boxes.  I solved it by switching off the HDMI-CEC functionality (called Anynet+) on the TV.

Description stated it was in used but like new condition but only the box itself looked beat up.  The TV came with all accessories in pristine condition with the original plastic wrapping covering it and nothing was missing.  TV is perfect size for my bedroom and I could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: love, love my tv

Reviews.Content: I waited for a few months to leave my review so I could use it and determine quality and I LOVE IT! Easy to use and picture is awesome!

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: It's easy to assemble the base and connect the tv to the wireless internet.  We were able to easily upgrade the firmware using the wireless internet.  The picture is beautiful.  We are very pleased with that.The attachment to allow the remote to control Directv was somewhat problematic, so we stopped using that.  I think the Directv receiver is meant to stay powered on.  When we'd turn on the Samsung using the Samsung remote with this small Samsung device in front of the Directv receiver, the Directv receiver would turn off and then pop back on.  This, in turn, would cause the tv to turn off.  It took several attempts to get them both turned on at the same time.  It's probably easier to get the Directv remote to control the tv.

Reviews.Title: Problem with Apps
Reviews.Author: Thomas E.
Reviews.Content: I have a Samsung UN40F5500 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz Slim Smart LED HDTV and the color is great. The TV is in a bright room with windows an there is NO glare on the screen.As soon as you get your new smart TV go to Menu button and turn on the menu. Go to Support, Go to Software update and get the latest update and set it on automatic update.I purchased a wireless keyboard so I do not have to use the very slow way of using the remote to enter letters and numbers. The remote method is slower than the old way to phone texting. The Web app works well with my wireless keyboard which is a Adesso  model wkb-3000u with a trackball which is faster than a touch pad. However, Netflix app does not work with the keyboard, you have to use the remote which is very slow.This is a good start at being a Smart TV, but Samsung needs to make their system faster and easier to use. Their remote is just to slow and it is NOT user friendly. If they are going to sell Smart TVs they need to make their remote, an easy to use KEYBOARD and make all the apps work with a keyboard. As a TV, it is great. Love the HD color and no glare. After using a computer, the Samsung is not smart it is learning and Samsung can make a Smart TV if they try harder.Still, this is a Good TV and would recommend it to anyone. It is a good start at making your TV a computer.

Reviews.Title: This TV is Ridiculously Great
Reviews.Author: K. Rosinbum ""chickentender""
Reviews.Content: I am truly glad I waited more than a year to buy a new television. I looked at Samsung and Vizio and several others last summer and wound up sticking with my old 24in Samsung (which I still believe to be an incredible small tv/monitor - it's sound quality is head&shoulders; above this newer set, surprisingly) and letting the "smarts" evolve a bit more. I am very glad that I did.This TV has impressed me in nearly every way. The interface is intuitive, the picture quality is outstanding and the sound is more than passable for such a thin and light flatscreen. (this review is of the 32in model - I personally don't think anyone needs a tv larger than that in their home, perhaps up to a 40in if the room is incredibly large. too much emphasis is placed on the TV in american homes and too little on conversation and "living"... but that is an entirely different subject)My only complaint is that the tv *only* has line level audio available from *both* the analog and digital outputs, e.g. you cannot control the volume level of those outputs via the TV's remote. It they'd included a way to switch this in the software I'd have given the TV 5 stars.Even the onboard HD OTA/Cable tuner is fantastic. We use only OTA broadcast signal for our normal tv watching and this tv picks up more channels clearer and more reliably than my dedicated HD OTA Samsung tuner that I've used for years prior. It also creates an *extremely* well put together channel guide, with options to schedule viewing etc, based on your local listings. Very very well done and implemented. Makes my old STB look *truly* like an old dinosaur.My Xbox360 will likely see much less use (though it is still superior in some areas, such as watching MP4 encoded videos. I've not tested thoroughly on the Samsung but it seems that, depending on the codec used --most of mine are the very common h.264/AAC-- some options, like skipping forward or backward are not available (not so on the XBox)... Hopefully this can be addressed down the road with software updates. Netflix and Amazon Prime both looked fantastic, as did pretty much everything I threw at this tv after setting it up yesterday afternoon and playing with it/watching it until late last night.Overall, I think this set is fantastic and darn near perfect. Hats off to Samsung - as usual they've manufactured a quality set.UPDATE: 7/22/2013 Still very very much enjoying this tv. At first I did not care for the Eco settings which can dim the screen based on ambient light in the room ... I have it on its most modest setting and at time (rare) it gets too dim but most of the time it does a good job, keeping the screen lit enough to see all the details but without being so bright in a dim room. Definitely saves your night vision late at night, or if you turn on the tv when it's late it does not blind you with how bright it is.Only other complaint I have is that support for some digital video files is limited, e.g. I have a small number of mp4 and mkv files... most of which the tv will play, but you cannot skip ahead or backward. This is not a problem unless you stop a movie (purposefully or by accident) and want to go ahead to where you were, or just skipping ahead in general, or backward because you missed something. It will only play some files from beginning to end, so for that my xbox is still used more often. Hopefully, again, this can be fixed with future software updates. Still a fantastic tv in my opinion though.

Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a christmas gift, but after only 3 months, 1 horizontal and 1 vertical line of dead pixels appears on the screen.  I tried contacting Samsung but they keep giving me the run around, sending me back to the same trouble-shooting steps on their website that I've run through a hundred times already.  I guess I'll just keep trying, until I can get in touch with someone who will actually listen to me.It was a nice TV for those first 3 months, but if you have problems like I did, be warned, you're in for a support center nightmare. Reviews.Title: Mediocre picture -- great programming guide
Reviews.Author: Peter M.
Reviews.Content: Overall, I am disappointed in the picture quality but very pleased with the "smart" features.I would have said 3 and 1/2 stars if I knew how.I am disappointed with the picture quality but very pleased with the "smart" features.I have adjusted the picture as suggested by several online reviewers who use tools and science to optimize the variables.  I have tried 4 or 5 recommended settings, and done some tinkering of my own.  But I remain dissatisfied with the picture quality -- it is simply not as sharp as the screen on a Vizio I bought for a different room at the same time.  And I must change the picture choices whenever I view it at night in a dark room after making adjustments for daytime viewing in a bright room.  Engaging the auto detection feature that is supposed to do this does not seem to do the job.  This model's picture rates 3 stars at best.The program guide included in the smart features is a blessing.  It was the inclusion of this feature that tipped my choice in favor of this model (so far as I know, only Samsung has this feature).  I use an over-the-air antenna, and Samsung's guide is better than the guide my cable service provided when I had cable service.  The Samsung guide gives more information about upcoming or current shows and allows you to schedule future viewing or recording, so when the selected show airs, your TV or recorder automatically shifts to the selected show.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the bedroom.
Reviews.Author: Marcus
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv from amazon warehouse, it said no scratches so I took a chance. The tv is like brand new no scratches as described (thank goodness). It only cost me about 320 so it worked out well.. I haven't had any issues and have had it for a month and couple weeks.Alright, on to the tv. I love everything about it. The picture is really good.. not like soap opera good which is a good thing. You can adjust the brightest and backlight to your wanting. The sound is good in my opinion I noticed before I bought this tv some people said it was ok. That's not true.. it meet my expectations. Of course your not going to get theater sound all around, but lets be honest movie theater sounds have tons of expensive sound equipment don't think for a second just because you get a tv it's going to be like this home entertainment system without dropping some dollars on it for upgrades. The apps run well, I can't really say I have issues, it's rare but at times the app can sort of freeze and not work but you can easily hit the home button and restart it. I do hate how sometimes my tv seems to drop (WiFi) forcing me to put my password every now and then but it doesn't occur to often for it to be a headache. There are tons of free apps, workout apps that monitors your progress, apps for kids. You can go to Samsung movie apps and rent movies, add photos, sykpe if you have a web cam. I'm a college student and it also works great with my PS4 I don't get any lag or anything and picture looks nice. Even at regular settings. My two only cons is the remote controller. The search button is right under Netflix, hitting that accidentally will take you out of any app your on and but you back to the app homescreen, also the exit button is also next to the arrow navigation button so if I accidentally hit that I sometimes exit out an app.. oh surfing the web is a pain without a keyboard, it feels like forever.. and there's no pop up block so if you get on a webpage but as soon as you get on it, nothing is stopping it from being redirected to a site your not even worried about. I did get flash player to work on but it took a few shortcuts to get the page I wanted and dealing with pop ups. But it's not even worth the hassle. Just use a computer or laptop. Other than that it's a great tv. Netflix looks good and works flawlessly, havdnt used amazon prime or hulu but I expect it will look great as well. When I have kids I would invest in a smart tv. I watch YouTube channels a lot, I can control YouTube as well as anyother app that's on my tv with my HTC One. I can also use my HTC One as a remote . Of course I don't do it often no point of wasting my battery for that. It's a nice feature if you don't wanna get up and do a more detailed search through your phone and have it play on your tv. Oh and my tv has never shut off randomly without my permission to do so.

Reviews.Content: Just got it this afternoon.  I am 63 and pretty good on a computer and own a Tablet but I am definitely not a Techie  I set this up in no time at all. Reviews.Title: Great TV......except for the stand design
Reviews.Author: R. Hiltz
Reviews.Content: Purchased the 32 inch set to replace and older LCD set in a bedroom, Specifically wanted the Smart TV features and the thin LED design with the smaller bezel. Installation is a breeze with the quick start guide. However, be aware the the quadpod stand foot print is significantly wider than a typical TV stand (for the 32 inch set 22" x 10.25" existing HDTV was 16" x11,25") and overhung the nightstand I was previously using. Updating the software took forever at about a hour (DSL) and the Smart TV works well except navigation is a little clunky. There is some motion blur on sports programming, so if you watch a lot of fast action TV, you may want to step up to 6300 series which has a 120Hz refresh rate (5500 series @ 60 Hz). One annoying feature is that when you mute the TV, the mute icon stays on the screen. This requires you to put the sound level at zero if your switching from the TV to an external audio source (and as one reviewer noted, neither of the HDMI inputs support ARC which in 2013 and at this price level is a major omission) One nice feature is that the sound output (digital audio) can be changed to PCM allowing any external device which may not support the Dolby encodes (my ZVOX did not) to operate. Overall a pretty good HDTV with nice picture but a couple of questionable design/engineering issues.

Reviews.Title: TV itself is fine - but beware of surround sound setup!
Reviews.Author: JoeF
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal fan of Samsung for quite some time now.  I decided to purchase the Samsung UN46F5500 46-Inch Smart TV for my mom and was super excited at how quick it arrived.  TV setup was fairly straight-forward, and the Smart TV apps were nicely organized and ready for use.I had also purchased a Samsung Blue Ray Home Theater system to connect with it.  Long story short, I could NOT get the TV to produce surround sound through just the HDMI cable.  Yes - I did confirm the HTS supports ARC through HDMI.  And yes know I could've used the Audio Optical cable.  But I wanted only an HDMI connection using the HDMI/ARC technology.  Well it turns out this TV does NOT support HDMI/ARC.  And NO where online was this mentioned on the spec sheets.  Only after spending countless hours (and trips to buy new HDMI cables) trying to get TV sound through the Home Theater, I found a detailed manual online (not even the manual that came with the TV) that indicated this model does not support ARC.Needless to say I am extremely disappointed that I have to return it.  I really wish these vendors would show a picture of the back of their TV's in the online ads and/or list something specific about support of HDMI ARC.  So buyers beware - if you want to connect this TV to a Home Theater system so you can get surround sound from the TV (e.g. through Smart TV apps like Netflix), the HDMI connections will NOT support this!

Reviews.Title: Love the Smart Features
Reviews.Author: Scott Miller
Reviews.Content: I finally bought a TV because I was tired of watching Movies and TV Shows on my laptop. All I can say is, Wow!! It really makes a difference watching Doctor Who on a 32" HD screen. If you've only seen your favorite Guilty Pleasure on a 15" screen, I highly recommend the investment. Just be prepared to spend a month re-watching some of your favorite shows. I cannot speak to the picture quality, other than to say it looks great.I bought this model because of the Smart Hub feature. So far I have not needed to connect it to Cable.Overall I like the Smart Hub features. The Samsung Apps store has a Very Good  (on a scale of Poor to Excellent) selection of Apps. It's not quite the selection you get from Roku, but Samsung does include YouTube, and UStream, which Roku does not at this time. Plus I get the best of both worlds since I have also connected my purple Roku box to HDMI_2.My criticisms of the Smart Hub read more like a wish list.When you first turn on the TV, it takes about 30 seconds to connect to the Smart Hub. This may seem trivial, but it is noticeable after a while.Some of the "Recommended Apps" cannot be removed. To name one App I most likely will never use: ESPN ScoreCenter. I'm not into ML sports, and I get all the info I want from friends who are. Also you cannot re-order the apps. I use some more than others, but I cannot re-order them for my preferences.A lot of the Apps are not keyboard-optimized. Netflix, for instance does not allow you to type searches in the search window. All you can do is use the keyboard to arrow between letters and then select them with enter - which is the same thing you can do with the remote.Audio. The audio is somewhat weak in most Apps. The worst is Amazon Instant Video. When I'm watching a Movie, I have to turn the audio up to 60+ in order to hear the dialogue. In most other Apps, 15 to 20 is usually pretty good.Things I do like about Smart Hub:Global Search. If you cannot find a TV Show/Movie in the usual places; Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Hulu, etc., you can search for it using Samsungs search.Samsung Link. You can connect your Windows PC to your TV using Samsung Link to view Photos, Videos, and Music.Web browser. The browser is actually useable, although it's one of those features I have thus far used only once, since I usually have my laptops, tablet, smartphone, and iPod Touch nearby when I'm watching TV.Samsung's fitness App. I don't use it exactly how it's intended to be used. While I exercise daily, this App is a great place to explore  new exercises, new workouts, and have a virtual partner to do some exercises on days I don't make it to the gym. I did have one problem with this App. When I first used it, it would hang and load videos slowly. I had to add Google Public DNS to my DNS Server List on my router. This took care of the issue. There may be better DNS servers to use - I chose Google because it was the first one I found, and it solved the problem.YouTube has a nice App called YouTube Leanback. This connects your tablet to the TV and allows you to search, play, and control videos from your tablet. It works well, and it is a lot more convenient than using the remote. Are you listening Netflix?One nice thing about Smart Hub is that it's software, so hopefully it will improve over time.

Reviews.Title: a good tv, DLNA server not great
Reviews.Author: Cherice Evans
Reviews.Content: This TV has an excellent picture and very good sound.  The streaming from NetFlix, Amazon and Hulu is superb.  Sadly, the same cannot be said about the DLNA player.  I have a Seagate Central 4 TB harddrive with videos on it.  I specifically purchased this TV because both the Samsung website and the Seagate website stated that the Seagate Media Share app worked.  Sadly, this app is not available for this model of TV.  Moreover, although the Samsung website states that the TV will stream videos with a frame rate of 6 -- 30 frames/second, this is not the case.  The frame rate must be between 29 and 30 frames/second and cannot be exactly 30 frames/second.  The NTSC rate of 29.97 frames/second is the preferred stream.  Thus, for much of my collection, I am having to redo the digital files to change the frame rate, since they were designed for apple devices (exactly 30 frames/sec).

Reviews.Title: Warning - Doesn't Maintain Connection with Netflix
Reviews.Author: Dolce
Reviews.Content: TV will not maintain a connection with Netflix.  The longest we have ever gone before we get a message from Netflix on the TV that says "unable to play that title right now" is through 2 20-minute episodes of anything.  Then if I go to settings it will say I'm not connected to WiFi, but I am.We are 100% certain it's a software issue with the TV with Netflix.  We will play the exact program, episode, etc at the exact same time with another TV that has Apple TV and without issue. When we get the error, we can click on Amazon app and play movies, further demonstrating the problem is with Samsung and Netflix compatibility issue.We Google'd this - and apparently the Netflix/Samsung issue is a HUGE issue talked about in numerous forums on the internet.Our next step is to call Samsung, but reports are out there that it takes 3-6 hours to get through to their customer service - so I will update as soon as we go that route.Also, TV picture out of the box needs work.  I researched this on the reviews on Amazon and used Gordon's settings.  I believe Gordon reviewed another Samsung TV that was not a SMART TV, but I kept seeing his name come up when people talked about their settings, so I found his review and used his settings.In the meantime, if you are looking for a SMART TV, I would suggest buying a standard TV and buying a Roku - which has roughly the same viewing options as what a SMART TV has.

Might last an hour or might last ten minutes. Because of that I could not give this TV a good review.That said. This appears to be a problem the plagues a LOT of television brands. So, I am not specifically saying anything against Samsung. I guess it is the cheap components they ALL are using to save a few pennies. Well, we do that to ourselves by being more focused on price than quality. Here is my suggestion. DON'T buy your TV from an online store. Do your research online and then by locally from a store with a policy to take it back if it does not work. I had to pay shipping to send mine back (which I am still fuming about and will reflect on the sellers review) which is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: N. Peterson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV because of the Samsung reputation and the price.  I wanted a TV for gaming and general viewing.  I had a 5 year old Samsung TV which had the 120hz feature and I specifically wanted a TV that was only 60hz this time around.  The 120hz "motion plus" or whatever the feature is called is practically useless.  It makes the movement of the picture "smoother" by inserting fake screens using built in processors.  Those screens aren't actually a part of the broadcast, the processors inside create them.  After watching a few minutes with the 120hz feature, I shut it off because everything looked wrong.  It's called the "soap opera effect".  It was a useless feature so this TV was perfect for my needs.I've played PS3, PS4, Xbox One, and PC games on this TV and they all look excellent.  This TV also has been rated "good" as far as input lag (28ms).  Many HDTVs have much higher input lags.  Please note that input lag has nothing to do with the lag you experience in online games.  You can check the input lags of various TVs at [...]Live broadcasts, Netflix, and other streaming looks excellent also.  My old TV wasn't a Smart TV and I really enjoy having a Smart TV this time.  All of the streaming apps such as Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Instant, HBO GO, and many more are installed.  I no longer have to access Netflix through my Xbox or Playstation.  I haven't had any issues with the apps that I've used unlike some of the other users.If you want a nice size TV for gaming or watching, I highly recommend this TV. I have honestly told friends and coworkers what a great set this is.

Reviews.Content: This TV is worth the price!  Compared to the Visio (priced at about $100 lower with similar features) this TV will last twice as long im sure. I had my last Samsung for 8 years until it recently broke and i got this one.  It hooks up great to my computer using an HDMI cable and fits my screen resolution to a T.  I play a lot of fast pace video games (PS3 and PC) and I dont notice any lag.  The TV and stand are very well designed and ascetically pleasing.  Some may hate on the type of plastic they use on the outside (because it is glossy and leaves finger prints) but lets be real, how often do we touch our TV to leave those finger prints.  All you need is a simple microfiber cloth to remove those prints.  The one gripe i had with this TV was how it would change the brightness automatically.  This would change even if the light settings wouldnt change.  This was a very easy fix and i just had to play around with the settings.  Another thing I would like to change (if possible) is that everytime i turn on the TV it goes to the smart menu, i would like to just turn on the TV and have it automatically hook up to which source i was using.  If anyone knows how to fix this please let me know.

Reviews.Title: Thinking of upgrading? Get it!
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I've been wowed by this Tv, no lie. I've gone through two standard definition tvs and a spare monitor just for the game. I wanted to to replace tha for 1 hdtv. You wont regret it. This is my first HDTV, tv period that I bought myself. I didn't get it from amazon, but from Best Buy (in store).What a dramatic upgrade, first impressions are astounding.Hooking up the stand to the TV was not a problem if you use the correct screw driver. I'm a noob at tool knowledge so that was a prob, because the size didn't fit, but I received help to use the right one. Manual directions a easy. Let's skip to the good.I have a small box room, and this TV fits perfectly. Use this with an hdmi cable for both the Console and Cable Box. The setup prompt plays a little music when the Tv first turns on and is smexy.going through the setup was easy, excluding wifi if you don't know what you are doing. A little experimenting with the WPS on the router and TV had me up and going. Note that your connection may effect the experiences. I have 4 bar according to the TV, and Apps flow pretty smoothly so far.Apps: An abundance of apps that my appeal to your interests, even a fitness one. Oh, and this TV does have a Web Browser. It works, but the cursor is a bit tedious to move with. It's ok if you don't mind feeling like barebones. Has Amazon, Yotube, HBO, Netflix, Skype, etc.Gaming: Picture quality is amazing with 360's hdmi. If you have been doing research on a good Led tv for Cable and gaming, then look no further. Imput lag is reported to be neglible. Around 30ms. I'm a Halo guy, and with game mode, I still felt some lag. I was just sucking (it was frustrating looking at the tv respond), but WAIT. If you want to reduce that lag, then turn off Dynamic Contrast (or was it eco sensor, both if it's not. Just mess with them). Game mode doesn't turn off everything. With that off, it completely did a 180 and I was sniping domes and 4 shotting fools like I was on my monitor or even better. Anyways what a big sigh of relief. Do not just depend on Game mode, as you will experience imput lag.Sound: Was the least impressing experience, even for my small room. My standard tvs sounded better at times, but you'll put up with it. In some areas the sound is improved. I recommend "Clear Voice" for sound mode. It's hard to choose. You could always get speakers, but still the sound is not bad for my room. It just could be much better.TV: Picture quality is great. Recommend movie mode as well and Warm 1 color. I swapped out my standard cable box for an old HD Box that we've had for some time. Might need a new one, because image looks foggy on some channels/choppy or grainy. The HD box I had was used on a Standard box for years. I only found that out recently that a certain someone was using a HD box for a SD TV this whole time -_-. Tis may just be a Cable box Issue, but even then, the problems don't appear frequently at all. The TV itself is an awesome buy for price and value.Magnificent first TV and would recommend to anyone. Had it for about 3 days. 4/5, but since I can't rate that, I will be damn well glad to give it a 5 over a 4.

Reviews.Title: Expensive for a 32" TV, but worth the extra cost
Reviews.Author: Josh90
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at a traditional electronics store after doing some online research and comparing it with other models in the store.  I was a little hung up on the cost of this model; many similarly-sized models sell for much less.  In the store I visited, most 32-inch TVs were selling for about $100 less than the $400 I spent on this one.  I bought it anyway because of the picture quality; this was easily the brightest and most vibrant TV available in this size class.  It may be expensive, but at least it has the picture quality to back up its price tag.  It also has a pretty attractive design; it's extremely thin and has a narrow 0.5" bezel.  After getting it home, I discovered that it has really impressive sound quality, too--at least for built in speakers.  Great picture and sound quality, wrapped into a thin and  attractive design.  As a simple TV, I doubt there is anything better on the market in this size class and price range.  Despite the 60Hz refresh rate, it even handles Xbox games with ease.The built-in features have left me less impressed.  Samsung boasts that smart TV features are powered by a dual-core processor, and the interface is pretty slick and hums right along without much stutter.  Software has been totally redesigned from last-years models.  The interface is completely different from the year-old 46" Samsung TV in my living room, and everything looks pretty good and works well.  The cheesy underwater background has been dropped in favor of a simple grid of icons with a monotone background.  It's much more understated and, for the most part, works well.  It even has a built-in channel guide, which is nice since I don't have a cable box in the bedroom this is going in.  Unfortunately, some of the web apps need work.  Hulu and Netflix load quickly and have smooth playback with high-definition picture quality, but the very first show I streamed stopped right in the middle with a playback error message.  This has been a problem with my living room TV as well.  It doesn't happen all the time, just often enough to be annoying.  It's clear that Samsung doesn't use the best WiFi chipsets in their TVs.  I loaded SpeedTest.net using the built-in browser, and it recorded a maximum download speed of just 2.63 Mb/s downstream.  After it was done, I turned on my MacBook and recorded 13.93 Mb/s downstream.  The slow WiFi chip is probably a big part of the problem.  I told Hulu to retry a couple of times, and eventually encountered a critical error that made me restart the app.  I unplugged and restarted the TV, and encountered the same error message after about ten minutes of streaming in Hulu.  The router is only about 15-20 feet away, so I don't see what the problem is when a laptop does just fine at the same distance.  For the record, I haven't had any of these issues when streaming content with an Apple TV or Xbox 360.  This isn't a huge deal, but these are expensive TVs given their size.The bottom line is that this is a truly excellent TV, it's just not very good at streaming content.  You could certainly get something bigger for the price, but this size is just about perfect for a bedroom.  If great picture and sound quality are what you're after, buy with confidence.

Reviews.Title: Defective Stand! (Great TV Otherwise)
Reviews.Author: AlbertoB17
Reviews.Content: Got the TV a while ago, was not able to set it up until recently but once I was able to take it out of the box, I realized that either the nails that came with the stand were defective, or the stand itself was defective. I cannot secure the TV onto the stand so we have to be very careful not to touch the TV because it is quite shaky!Other than this bad fault with the product, the TV is great, responsive and great quality for the cost.Hopefully no one else has found the stand to be defective like mine. The process to get a replacement has not been easy.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV!
Reviews.Author: Montes Soza Family
Reviews.Content: It is find and easy to use. The size is great. It is not small neither a big one. The  perfect size!

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: tugboatdriver37
Reviews.Content: Works great s a tv, have not tried for Smart functions. Could not tell it was not a new unit.Would definitely reccomend this seller.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Maxwell
Reviews.Content: My first smart TV ended up just being used like a normal TV. I tried the smart features and things just went way too slowly for me to want to use it. I had read up on this TV and discovered it was built in February 2013, so I was more confident in the hardware inside. I've had this one for a few months now and it's still working great. There were some snags at first with apps not working and my wifi info getting reset, but there were a couple updates that got released along the way and it seems to have cleared up my remaining issues. I ended up getting an ethernet cable to run it directly to my router since the wifi would slow down a bit here and there. I'm not sure if that's a wireless card issue in the TV or an ISP issue. Wired internet works great though.I also bought this TV to work as a monitor for my computer. When I want to watch Netflix, Hulu or Amazon I will just use the TV to save electricity. But it's nice having it function as a monitor as well so when I have movies not on the streaming sites, or if I need to print something, I can just switch to the PC source real quick. The TV also works with wireless keyboards and mice, so I picked up a combo keyboard that has the mouse trackpad. Makes it so much easier to navigate my shows and typing in login info as opposed to doing it with a remote control.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV
Reviews.Author: Romulo G.
Reviews.Content: TV samsung smart is the best of the best, I love your connection to internet, to USB devices, to hdmi devices,  the colors and resolution are incredibles

Reviews.Title: Very nice slim design TV.
Reviews.Author: Greg Stevenson
Reviews.Content: Great slim design TV. Very good picture and sound. Exceeds my expectations. My only negative is the tab that is mounted at the bottom of the TV which is the Samsung name plate; just don't care for the appearance.

Reviews.Title: BEAUTIFUL
Reviews.Author: Austin R. Schroder
Reviews.Content: BRITE COLORS CLEAR PICTURE EVERYTING YOU WANT IN A TV PEOPLE ARE LIFELIKE SOOO GLAD I GOT IT WOULD NOT TRADE IT IN

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40F5500 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz Slim Smart
Reviews.Author: Hicham Hassan
Reviews.Content: The goods:The sound is  good, the picture is very good.The Bad:The web browser needs lots of improvement and please try to do less with the stupid Advertisement for other companies. Too much advertisement in the remote control too. i.e Amazon and Netflix. It should be an option for your customer not to force it on us!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the TV
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: This tv is a great buy at $500.  Great picture quality.  Apps make Bluray/DVD player virtually obsolete.  I am very satisfied with this purchase.  Does not come with a paper/booklet instruction manual - it is online

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: JetsFan
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  I put in my kitchen and mounted on the wall.  It was the perfect size and looks great.  The slim design is great. The picture quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Loving it!!
Reviews.Author: Bree Towner
Reviews.Content: Im very happy with this tv. It has easy step by step set up instructions and a sleek look. The picture quality is great and the sound is so clear.  I love all the web features and apps right at my finger tips. 2 weeks of having this tv and I have no complaints so far :)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Joyce Clayton "readerworm"
Reviews.Content: This tv was the easiest to set up. Picture is beautiful; price was great. It took less than an hour to remove old tv, unpack and set up the Samsung. Best feature is the built in Operating Manual. Never bought this brand before, but love it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Chamlong Ratphimpha
Reviews.Content: Good size for bedroom.  A+++++ Love it.  Nice, thin, good looks in any direction.  Connect to my network, no problem.

Reviews.Title: Works great for our needs.
Reviews.Author: Jolthammer
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  Picture looks great.  Also love the fact that the remote has dedicated buttons for "NetFlix" and "Amazon Prime" videos.  No more have to explain to the wife every single day how to make Amazon Prime show up.

Reviews.Title: love my new  tV
Reviews.Author: Jessica Mercado
Reviews.Content: I love this TV! The smart feature makes it so I don’t have to use my Google Chrome; which is perfect! I love listening to Pandora and this makes it super easy. The guide display is awesome especially for digital antennas.  Very Happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Samsung smart tv
Reviews.Author: DJohn "DJohn"
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv.  We have several of the new Samsung series (2013 and up) TVs and all I feel are just exceptional. I would recommend them to anyone considering a new tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: M. B. "DJMannyB"
Reviews.Content: I love this TV! The screen size is a little smaller that I like, but I am using it in my bedroom so 40 inch was about the limit I wanted to adhere to.So whats to like about this TV? Firstly the picture quality is top notch. Regular TV as well as streamed videos (which of course depend on your internet connection speed) all come up looking very good. I attribute the quality of streamed videos looking good to a good wifi adapter in the TV. Other TVs flake here leading to choppy and interrupted viewing which I hate!The design is also very slick. Looks very sophisticated, and goes well with my urban themed bedroom.Something I love about this TV is that it includes Samsung’s Smart TV suite. It is very good, and I believe based on a dual core processor. This means navigation is very fast (my other TV although costing far more has slower navigation).The sound quality is also decent. You won’t be winning any bass competitions, but perfectly suited to a bedroom environment. In a more living room type situation a sound bar or an external receiver would probably add to the movie watching experience.All in all, a very good TV.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Jamaica
Reviews.Content: The picture is so clear and I love it.  It came on time and was easy to assemble and the instructions are very clear.

Reviews.Title: Great Samsung quality with Amazon...
Reviews.Author: Nelson Velez
Reviews.Content: Great smart flat screen from Samsung. Price is perfect. Nice size and great for my bedroom. Looking forward to buying a bigger screen with Samsung and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Our TV works great
Reviews.Author: BulletWithYourName "SendingItYourWay"
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the complaints of some people our tv works great. Sound is good picture is even better. It has tons of options, no firmware problems like the one liar was saying (they're just trying to get a new tv for free) all of the apps open quickly. The UI is quite snappy too. Only complaint is the remote is a little too busy so at night I'm pushing the wrong buttons quite often, however, being able to control my directv box makes up for it. Also the PressTV app. PressTV is an Iranian state sponsored and funded anti-American & anti-Israeli propaganda channel.I can also use my directv remote to adjust inputs, channel and volume on the TV which is awesome. I wish there were channel and volume buttons on the TV. I got this TV specifically for our bedroom and the PS4 I bought from Amazon. The graphics are amazing. This imo is the perfect size tv for a console it's almost like a PC monitor. I sit only a few feet away and the details are wicked. I think the lag input is around 30ms which is great for my uses. The wife loves playing Resogun and for a basic game the graphics between this TV and the PS4 are great. Very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, Standard Res a little weak
Reviews.Author: chase g bock
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Smart TV and when used in HD has excellent picture quality.  Compared to my Panasonic Vierra Plasma (probably not a fair comparison) the standard picture quality is not as good.  The functionality is good and it has and HBO GO app while my Panasonic doesn't.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32 inch tv
Reviews.Author: Kathleen S. Miller "Birdie"
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV as we had a  PREVIOUS Samsung and found it to be the best picture compared to other TV's.  And it is.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price!
Reviews.Author: Jay Matuk
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality, easy setup, sound system is perfect for bedroom or small den.  Minus one star only because the remote is not universal and I still need to use my cable company remote for certain functions.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jason Dang
Reviews.Content: Great brand. Brilliant color.Remote control is hard to use when searching for internet and youtube.Not much con at all.

Reviews.Title: Love it. Great Picture. Very good sound. Pretty good software for smart TV.
Reviews.Author: fays
Reviews.Content: I personally don't think TVs need anything over 60 hz refresh rate. There is nothing that is broadcast (including BluRay) in more than 30 Hz and the increased interpolated images that the TV software create  give a weird soap opera feel in my opinion for anything over 60 hz (if you think about it, the options are to refresh the same image more than twice or to create more interpolated images which means the TV would be creating more images than its receiving!). Either way, the image looks great and the TV is very thin. It is a bedroom television for me and my wife (and thus am glad it has no camera) and it is great for our purposes. I had bought a Vizio from Costco and returned it for this, and am very happy with that decision. I have stuck with Samsung for televisions for a while and they have not let me down. The sound is actually very great. I just bought a soundbar but think the TV itself has better sound, I'm returning the soundbar. The smart TV software is decent, and fantastic for our needs as we're almost exclusively using it for streaming netflix, hulu, and amazon shows/movies, all of which work great. My one beef is that the television does not stay connected to the Wifi when it's turned off, so we have to wait for it to connect (30 seconds?) before accessing the apps we use.

Reviews.Title: you cant beat it
Reviews.Author: speaks the truth
Reviews.Content: This TV has been a real job to have. I would purchase another one like it when I need it.

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Cooking Fool
Reviews.Content: It's light, energy efficient and lives up to its hype.  We had a bit of difficulty retro fitting it to the wall mount (had to go buy longer bolts but it has proven, so far, to deliver a clear crisp picture and good sound.  In this world of 60" and now 70" TVs, this is still a great TV at a great price

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: OSUrob
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my office.  I have a larger Samsung with the same Smart TV system and it works great.  I was skeptical about ordering online and having it shipped but it came without any issues.  Actually arrived a day earlier than Amazon said it would.  Performs great and looks nice on the wall.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Bronte T.
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the quality and standard of the product! I was unsure of this model compared to the EH5300 model, but this one was newer and has a better layout of the hub. Very impressed!

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: franco
Reviews.Content: Great Smart TV. Built in wireless Internet works great to watch any streaming movie. Great picture and good 40 size.I like the thin TV

Reviews.Title: Great little LED TV
Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: With setup a breeze (7 screws for the base), and plugging in our three HDMI cables (did I mention this has three HDMI inputs?), we're up and running.  Colors are great and the family consensus is that calibrating according to some available info on the web, gives a fantastic picture.  Everyone also appreciates the little stand this rests on.  I've been told by daughters especially that it's so much nicer than the plastic base their friends have.  The IR remote extender is a nice feature and perfect for the set top box we have in a cabinet beneath the TV.The Smart TV is really pretty remarkable.  Once I connected to WiFi, it automatically ran a system update and by evening, we were watching our Amazon Prime videos in streaming glory.  There's even Amazon Prime and Netflix buttons on the remote for quick and easy access!So far, we've had no issues with the WiFi.  And, some other reviewers have written about muddy sound, but, again, no complaints.Will update if anything goes seriously wrong, but so far, meriting 5 *****

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: ramona f valles
Reviews.Content: I like the picture. It is really good. The sound is perfect . The wifi no problems at all. Great product. Considering to buy another bigger

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Margarita Esparragoza
Reviews.Content: Slim and staylish and I can browse the internet. This is the perfect TV. I want to by a keyboard for it but havent been able to find one.

Reviews.Title: great TV for money !!!
Reviews.Author: david bain
Reviews.Content: THIS TOOK A LITTLE ASSEMBLY FOR BASE but it works amazing and has such an awesome wifi system integrated I have never been happier with a small smart TV as it is priced well for all it offers.  Next time I order one I will get a slightly larger one but this is ideal for bedroom or office.

Reviews.Title: So far so good,
Reviews.Author: bluivory&&
Reviews.Content: I was dismayed by the Amazon packaging.  It came in the naked box, barely held together, the insides were held in by a slim piece of tape. The starfoam was visible, and the box had clearly been tossed around. Had I been here when they delivered it, I would have refused the package.  It looked like the minimal foam did its job, so being somewhat trapped in a snowstorm lasting a few days, I plugged it in.  The TV has a beautiful picture, although the sound quality could be much improved.  Our house has another larger model, of the Samsung LED Smart HDTV, and it has the same sound issues.  I bought a warranty, but despite its scary arrival, it seems fine.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Sal
Reviews.Content: We initially ordered the same TV in a smaller size but turned out that was too small for our living room. So we returned that. Amazon arranged a pick up from our house. Although the TV was not eligible for exchange but interestingly the next day, the UPS guy showed up again with a new TV in the same , small size. There must have been some confusion. Meanwhile we ordered the bigger 46 inch one on prime. We didn't get a brand new one but decided to go for a "used-like new" TV from Amazon Warehouse. It arrived in an Amazon carton instead of a Samsung one but was shining like new with the screen protector and all other coverings/ stickers/ accessories! It was very easy to set up and synchronize with different accounts like amazon prime / netflix etc.. These two have a dedicated button on the remote control too. But there are dozens of other apps as well, even skype / FB etc. The picture quality is very good. Sound is kind of okay-ish. You might want to consider external speakers. Anything played on TV sounds fine but if you're streaming something from laptop connected via HDMI then it can be a little bothersome finding the perfect video with a loud enough sound. The display settings need a bit of tweaking and I followed the settings that I found in one of the reviews below. It's all good now. We don't even have a cable connection nevertheless we absolutely enjoy the TV experience!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: cynthia getgen
Reviews.Content: It has an awesome picture and the sound exceeded my expectations. Still trying to figure all the functions out but support is very helpful when I call them. Would highly recommend this TV. Great TV and great price!

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: S. kidd
Reviews.Content: The picture is great and the smart tv features work well for me. I paired it with a digital attena and most nights I get 16 channels including most major networks.And the Amazon prime feature is really nice. Meets my needs.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Albaro B.
Reviews.Content: It was more than I expected. I recommended for those who are looking for a great HDTV and a low price. I bought the 32" for my bedroom (It is small) and it's fine but I recommend to you all a bigger one.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup, Needed Special Screws to Mount to Wall
Reviews.Author: Benjamin E Taitelbaum
Reviews.Content: Setup and installation were easy. My biggest complaint is that the ergonomics of the remote don't make it obvious where the arrow/enter buttons are, but I quickly learned where they were nonetheless.I bought this along with the VonHaus TV Wall Tilt Bracket (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00CS0T678/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_1), which didn't come with the correct screws to attach this tv. I found that M8-1.25x40 screws fit perfectly. I got ones with a socket head cap, so I can hand tighten them easily.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Stand not so much
Reviews.Author: JackDay
Reviews.Content: This 32in is a TV for our bedroom.  It is placed on top of my tall 7 drawer dresser (about 5.5 ft tall).The TV is good, picture, sound, etc.  On/off timers are great.The stand takes too much room and hard to dust. This is a 32 in TV and the stand takes more room that the stands for both our Vizio 40in and Vizio 55in.

Reviews.Title: New to me
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This is my first flat screen, it's very clear, works great.  Home network, wife just started sending from her Nexus 7, we love it.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Our Samsung TV arrived in record time, was packaged very well, and looks great in our bedroom. The only thing that would have been very helpful were the screws that were needed to attach it to the wall mount - they were not included with this model.  So took a little longer to get it set up than we hoped as we had to go shopping first!  It is really lightweight which makes it great for hanging on the wall.

Reviews.Title: Excellent,excellent and excellent is all I can say about this TV
Reviews.Author: Mike ZH "Mike ZH"
Reviews.Content: Excellent,excellent and excellent is all I can say about this TV. Picture, sound and Smart TV feature - awesome !!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: H. De Nike
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up, picture is perfect, no issues with colors. Love the ease of getting to Netflix and Amazon.  Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: An amazing TV for a good price
Reviews.Author: H K LIGHT
Reviews.Content: It is really a smart TV. Apps working perfect, specially YouTube and Amazon instant video. The picture is amazing and the sound is rocking. I have not tried all its features for a fuller review. But all in all is a good buy except that after watching you tube on it for a long time, the screen becomes black and you need to switch off the TV and switch it on again, not that bad. The full web browser is working but of course not like a computer or tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Sound and Quality Finish
Reviews.Author: Rodster
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic deal this TV is especially at this price and you can't beat the 24 month no interest finance if you're interested. I recently returned two 32" LED Visio's for dead pixel problems. I noticed this is the current year model and after all the glowing reviews I purchased one and i'm glad I did.The picture is crisp and sharp with no noticeable backlight issues. The sound is good enough for a TV. Everything works perfectly and no dead pixels detected. The remote is responsive and the buttons are well laid out. It was very easy to setup and I was amazed at how light (19 lbs) it is and it takes up less space than my Toshiba 40" because of the reduced bezel.The only issue I had was the TV not properly logging into my Wifi router, after several attempts it finally did. The other minor hiccup was figuring out how to enable the apps. I looked in the manual and didn't find any information. I was able to access the apps after I locked them which seemed odd. I linked the TV with my Amazon account. Now I need to figure out how to do a system update.My only regret is not buying the 46" model.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Laura Bee
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a smart TV for a reasonable price, I found it here with the Samsung 40-inch Slim. its pretty sleek and the picture looks great.The built in apps work well, Amazon Prime/Netflix/Hulu are the most used and I can stream in HD wirelessly with little loading issues.I wish Samsung offered more Apps... and a note for Comcast users, the HBO Go app does not work for Comcast users. The browser is a bit wonky, and a wireless keyboard would greatly benefit this TV.Overall solid picture, pretty decent default apps and a great slim look.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding LED TV
Reviews.Author: Dale Terrell
Reviews.Content: The picture from the Samsung UN50F5500 TV is everything that I expected and then some.  It was very easy to install - just plug in my HDMI cable and the power cable.

Reviews.Title: amazing tv!  Has plugs for every device we need hooked up!
Reviews.Author: Rachel P.
Reviews.Content: We bought this one because we already had a smaller one.  It is perfect!!!!!  This tv is smart!  We also watch Hulu and Netflix, and even check our Facebook.  The sound is good and picture us fabulous quality!  Its light weight is great because after my surgery I can't lift anything heavy.  Its easy to assemble, too.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40F5500 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz Slim Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: David King "littlebrit"
Reviews.Content: Works exactly if not better than advertised.  Great picture, good sound and very easy to set up.  Lots of "smart" options which I',m still learning.  Great product.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Lois M.
Reviews.Content: Super sharp picture. Very easy to use "smart" functions, even for this older owner. Impressed the grandchildren with the interactive features.

Reviews.Title: Great value for money
Reviews.Author: cesar
Reviews.Content: Great led tv. Lots of features and easy to set up. Love the image. I can even control it with my iPhone. All the apps need it already instal.

Reviews.Title: What are you doing? Buy this tv!
Reviews.Author: Buell owner
Reviews.Content: Excellent tv for the price. I would recommend it for anyone looking for deep blacks and smooth transitions. This tv is perfect for watching sports, or for large scale cinematic movies.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Offers Best Picture
Reviews.Author: George J. Kerry "Book Bug"
Reviews.Content: I have now purchased three Samsung HDTVs. They have never disappointed me in providing the clearest and most brilliant picture of any TV I have owned. I also give high marks to Samsung's factory service.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: So far I am very pleased with this TV.  We just bought this house and I am still in the process of un-packing. We put this TV in our living room and have a 40" Sony in one bedroom and a 32" Samsung in the other bedroom.  I am still configuring everything, but so far I just love it.  We got Direct TV and I'm annoyed that my Netflix won't work through them.  But, thank heavens it works through the TV, so we're good.  I don't care what I buy from Amazon, I get quick delivery, and everything arrives just like it would had I bought it in a store.  Kudos to Amazon!!  Here's the link to the TV I bought....B00BCGRX9W

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: MKS
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, especially at the price.  I purchased two of these and the picture is just great.  I found the eco-brightness to be a bit irritating, so that was one of the first things I turned off.  They're phenomenal TVs!

Reviews.Title: good tv,1st flat for me
Reviews.Author: mar gro
Reviews.Content: like but cant input software into computor part of tv, tried to add anntena to get wifi to watch movies!!!

Reviews.Title: Great flatscreen with all the bells and whistles
Reviews.Author: fastchase
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up with DISH and internet.  Great picture and good sound.  More than another model but I believe for the little difference in cost it is more than worth it with its features.

Reviews.Title: Great price for this
Reviews.Author: B. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I just needed a fairly inexpensive TV to put in our workout room. Always liked Samsung TVs, so was between this one and the model under it that didn't have the Smart Hub. For a TV, under $600, I don't think you can go wrong with this one. Picture is good. Smart Hub is nice to have (stream Netflix, Amazon, MLB.TV, etc). I'm not super critical of this TV since it's used in a workout room, and it's a $600 TV (which is on the lower end of TVs these days, not because I consider that to be a small sum of money). If I had to say one negative, the sound quality is mediocre. If you do use this as your main TV, I'd highly recommend external speakers, a sound bar, or something like that. The TV is lightweight in case you need to move it around or hang it, it looks nice (styling and picture quality), and has worked without problems.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my space
Reviews.Author: Paula Hanks
Reviews.Content: Perfect size for my space... Great picture quality. Had it up and running in no time. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32-Inch Slim Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Wayne Lee
Reviews.Content: The price was right. Expected a bigger box, was surprise at the size and weight of the TV. Got product in good condition and within 2 weeks. Like the internet capability, I use skype a lot. So far no complains.

Reviews.Title: smart decision
Reviews.Author: NRD
Reviews.Content: On time delivery and no flaws on tv at all, I'd have given a 5 star if it had  had a function to read the SD card as well. On the whole its a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: overall, a good tv
Reviews.Author: Joe L in Fla
Reviews.Content: I like the product, except a menu always comes on when I turn the tv on that I always have to exit out of.  Not the smoothest transaction in the world because, initially, I ordered a tv listed as new and was subsequently informed that the tv was mis-listed and should've been listed as used.  Amazon, though, did what they could to make it right.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality and nice thin design
Reviews.Author: Mike 55
Reviews.Content: Much nicer than my older Samsung 32inch. The picture quality is superb. The border around the screen is much smaller and it looks way more modern. Only complaint I have is the Apps- the Netflix App worked and then stopped and we had to reinstall it.It is worth spending the extra money to get the better picture and thinner design. 1080pixels really help.

Reviews.Title: Great smart TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Stephen G. Powers
Reviews.Content: Just getting use to it really, so my only complaints is that Samsung should have a compatible keyboard or at the very least have suggestions on other brands that would mate up a F5500. Hard for me to use the Internet with the included remote.

Reviews.Title: Fills the screen with picture not frame!
Reviews.Author: mary bertolotti
Reviews.Content: We are enjoying the TV.  Still need to figure out the WIFI features.  The base is silver and would blend in better in black.  However, if you want to hide a TV in a 36 1/2 in console this makes the grade with little frame around the TV and more screen!

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV! 2 thumbs up!
Reviews.Author: Ivan A.
Reviews.Content: I only have good things to say about this Smart TV. Picture quality is outstanding - crisp and clean. Sound is OK, not bad at all. Of course you're better off buying a sound bar or external speakers.Smart features are very good. All the apps that came with my TV out of the box were working in v.1013. Netflix, YouTube, Amazon, HBO Go etc. Not sure why some weren't working for Matthew Mueller.Being that its dual core, the speed and performance are good. UI navigation is very user friendly.Finally, the physical aspects of TV are good. It would be nice if it was slimmer, but for a 32" I'd say its perfect. It comes in at 12 lbs, so no sweat here. Not too sold on the TV stand -  I think that's the least part of the TV that I liked.So, for anyone looking to buy this TV, if it's in your price range - I'd definitely say it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: TV stopped working within 1 week.
Reviews.Author: Sci Fi Chick "sci fi chick"
Reviews.Content: TV was Christmas present. By Jan 3, the video/TV screen was blank and black. Audio was still able to be heard. Tech support was called and they were less than helpful as to cause and suggested a repairman (would call to set up appt within 1 week!). Decided to return TV and request replacement. Hopefully, new TV will work better. Other than not working- we really liked the TV and features.

Reviews.Title: My Honest Take
Reviews.Author: M. Bishopski "Lost in the Woods"
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to thank Amazon for such excellent packaging.  UPS did their best to tear something up but thanks to the double packaging, this TV made it safely.This TV for for my bedroom.  Its my first Samsung in years after they sold me a dud several years ago when LED first came out.The picture is good not great as many suggested below.  This is in comparison to my 58 inch LED Panasonic from Costco.  The Panasonic wins hands down regardless of how many settings I change.The sound is fine but no TV these says this small can offer what I call acceptable sound.  Compared to the Panasonic I would say its about equal.The interface on the Samsung is too much.  Tons of stuff I dont need eating away at my download cap.  Page after page on silly stuff I will never use.  The Panasonic is much better with a very simple yet powerful menu.The look is good but again, its a tie at best. Reviews.Title: Six months in and waiting for the repairman.
Reviews.Author: Jezreel Jones
Reviews.Content: This is my first LED TV so I decided to wait a while before writing a review since I didn't have a basis of comparison. The TV has excellent picture quality and very good sound volume. For the first five months, the TV functioned very well. At about 5 and a half months it started shutting down unexpectedly on its own. Gradually, the problem increased dramatically to the point where it would turn off and on repeatedly so often that it became unusable for all practical purposes.In researching my specific problem, I learned that hard drive failures are a common problem with Samsung TV's as well as some other manufacturers. Since the TV is still within the manufacturer's one year warranty, Samsung has arranged for an in-home repair. I'm hopeful that once the part is replaced tomorrow, the issue will be permanently resolved.My last TV was an old fashioned analog that served me well for more than 20 years. While, I know that electronics and other consumer products are not made to last as long as they used to, I certainly didn't expect the TV to become unusable and require parts replacement within 6 months of purchase.Frankly, I'm not sure I would recommend this model of LED TV until I felt confident that Samsung had permanently resolved its long standing issue with sudden and catastrophic equipment failure.Updated 5/17/14:My TV was repaired, at Samsung's expense, by a United Service Source, Inc.(USSI) sub-contractor who installed a new mainboard. The TV has performed exceptionally well since then. In fact, I think the TV is functioning better than at any time since I purchased it 6 months ago.I'll post another update in about 6 months.
